0.title: Will restore Ukrainian rule in Crimea: Prez Zelenskyy ahead of I-Day
0.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has vowed to restore Ukrainian rule over Russia-annexed Crimea, a move he claims will be the "biggest anti-war step". Zelenskyy further said that such a step will help re-establish "world law and order". His remarks come ahead of the country's Independence Day, August 24, which also marks six months since Russia invaded Ukraine.

1.title: Canada adds 62 Russian individuals, 1 defence firm to sanctions list
1.article_body: Canada has added 62 Russian individuals and one defence sector entity to its Russian sanctions regime in response to the invasion of Ukraine, Canadian PM Justin Trudeau said in a statement on Tuesday. The freshly sanctioned individuals include Russian federal governors and regional heads, and senior officials of already sanctioned defence firms, Trudeau informed.

2.title: She was like a mother figure to me: Rahul Vaidya after Sonali Phogat's death
2.article_body: Mourning the demise of Bigg Boss 14 contestant and TikTok star Sonali Phogat, singer Rahul Vaidya said, "I'm in deep shock." "She had come for my wedding, and recently when my single released on Friendship Day, she asked me to send...the song," he said, adding, "I wouldn't call her a friend, she was...like a mother figure to me, very affectionate."

3.title: A huge compliment: Archana on being compared to Nawazuddin's 'Haddi' look
3.article_body: Archana Puran Singh has reacted after being compared to Nawazuddin Siddiqui's look in his upcoming film 'Haddi'. She said it's "a huge compliment" to be compared to Nawazuddin in "any way possible". "It's the hairstyle which has become synonymous with me that's causing all these comparisons. I've used this side-parted look during the early part of Kapil show," said Archana.

4.title: Neeraj recovers from groin injury, to participate in Lausanne Diamond League
4.article_body: Tokyo Olympics gold medallist Neeraj Chopra confirmed that he'll be participating in upcoming Lausanne Diamond League 2022. He had pulled out of Commonwealth Games 2022 due to a groin injury sustained in Oregon last month. "Feeling strong and ready for Friday...See you in Lausanne!" tweeted Neeraj. The javelin thrower won India's first-ever silver medal at World Athletics Championships in July.

5.title: Disney appoints ex-Google employee Sajith Sivanandan as head of Hotstar
5.article_body: Disney International has appointed Sajith Sivanandan as Executive Vice President and Head of Disney+ Hotstar who was previously working with Google. Sivanandan's role will begin from October, and will report to both Rebecca Campbell, Chairman of Disney's International content and operations group and K Madhavan, President, Disney Star. His role includes overseeing Hotstar's India operations.

6.title: Akshay Kumar & Arshad Warsi to unite for 'Jolly LLB 3': Reports
6.article_body: Akshay Kumar and Arshad Warsi will reportedly star in Subhash Kapoor's 'Jolly LLB 3'. Arshad played the titular role in the first instalment of 'Jolly LLB', while Akshay featured in 'Jolly LLB 2', which released in 2017. As per reports, the third instalment, which is based on a relevant topic, will go on floors in the first half of 2023.

7.title: Mumbai-bound IndiGo aircraft develops snag in engine at Goa airport
7.article_body: An IndiGo aircraft carrying 187 passengers, including four infants, developed a snag in its right engine while proceeding to the runway at the Goa airport on Tuesday, a senior official said. The flight was scheduled to fly to Mumbai. All the passengers were disembarked safely by the rescue teams and the aircraft was taken to the taxi bay.

8.title: Man sets self on fire near Maha Vidhan Bhavan over property issue
8.article_body: A man set himself on fire outside the Vidhan Bhavan in Mumbai due to an unresolved property dispute with his brother. Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said he has ordered a probe into the matter and that the man's father had also attempted suicide over the dispute a few months back. The man sustained 15-20% burn injuries.

9.title: Suspended Telangana BJP leader Raja Singh granted bail hours after arrest
9.article_body: Suspended Telangana BJP leader T Raja Singh was granted bail on Tuesday within hours of being arrested after a court returned his remand application. The court has ordered that Singh be released immediately. He was arrested over alleged derogatory remarks against Prophet Muhammad following massive protests in Hyderabad.

10.title: ED registers money laundering case against Sisodia in Delhi Excise Policy scam
10.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Tuesday registered a money laundering case against Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia in connection with the Delhi Excise Policy 2021-22 case. CBI shared a copy of the FIR against Sisodia and other relevant documents pertaining to the case with ED on Sunday. Sisodia alleged he was "targeted" as he holds a position in Arvind Kejriwal's cabinet.

11.title: Felicitating any accused is wrong: Fadnavis on Bilkis Bano convicts
11.article_body: Reacting to a discussion on the release of the convicts in the Bilkis Bano gangrape case, Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said that felicitating any convict is wrong. "The accused have been freed after completing nearly 20 years...But it's wrong if any accused is welcomed...There's no justification for this [act]," he said. The convicts were reportedly garlanded after their release.

12.title: Mamaearth tops Practus Hurun India PE Performers ranking
12.article_body: SharkTank host Ghazal Alagh founded Honasa Consumer (Mamaearth) has topped the Practus Hurun India PE Performers 2022 ranking, with a growth of 491% over the last year and pharmaceutical company Encube Ethicals ranked second with a growth of 343%. The report ranks the best performing private equity-backed companies. Sequoia Capital India, Norwest Venture Partners were among the top five investors.

13.title: Want to direct an action film someday: Gulshan Devaiah
13.article_body: Actor Gulshan Devaiah said he would like to direct a film or go back to fashion if he had to make a career switch. The actor said that while he is not yet ready for direction, he would like to "direct an action film someday" without the usual tropes. "I want to approach it like a drama," he added.

14.title: Vijay has been accepting of my opinions on ‘Arjun Reddy’: Ananya
14.article_body: Ananya Panday said she didn't judge Vijay Deverakonda for his film 'Arjun Reddy'. Defending him, Ananya said, "As actors, we are not what we portray on-screen." Ananya said Vijay was "very accepting" of her opinion on the film. The actor had recently said that she wouldn't be or let her friends be in the kind of relationship the film showcases.

15.title: Policeman kills pregnant wife & flees; locals torch his house in J&K
15.article_body: A Special Police Officer (SPO) allegedly bludgeoned his pregnant wife to death in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua district on Tuesday following an argument, officials said. The woman's baby died in her womb, officials added. SPO Mohan Lal, who was on leave, fled the murder scene before neighbours arrived. Officials said agitated people torched his house before police controlled the situation.

16.title: India's top order will be delighted by Shaheen's absence at Asia Cup: Styris
16.article_body: Scott Styris has said not just India but every top order will be delighted by Shaheen Shah Afridi's absence at upcoming Asia Cup 2022. "It gives them a greater chance of winning the tournament," he added. Shaheen has been ruled out due to a knee injury. Earlier, Waqar Younis said, "Shaheen's injury [is a] big relief for...Indian top order batsmen."

17.title: Hungary weather service heads fired after inaccurate rain forecast
17.article_body: The two top officials of Hungary’s meteorological service were fired on Monday after they made an inaccurate forecast, which prompted the postponement of a fireworks display on a national holiday. Fireworks in Budapest to commemorate St Stephen's Day were called off after rains were predicted, which turned out to be false. The meteorological service had also reportedly issued an apology.

18.title: Cheteshwar Pujara smashes hundred off 75 balls in one-day match, his 3rd ton in 11 days
18.article_body: Cheteshwar Pujara on Tuesday smashed hundred off 75 deliveries while representing Sussex against Middlesex in the Royal London One-Day Cup 2022. Pujara went on to score 132 runs off 90 deliveries in the match. The 34-year-old has now slammed three hundreds in List A cricket in the last 11 days. He also crossed 500 runs in the ongoing tournament.

19.title: SC transfers conman Sukesh & his wife to another jail from Tihar
19.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) has ordered that conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar and his wife be moved from Delhi's Tihar Jail to Mandoli Jail in the city. Chandrashekhar and his wife had filed a plea seeking a transfer to a jail outside Delhi alleging a threat to their lives. The conman is in prison on charges of money laundering and duping people.

20.title: Debate on freebies needed for welfare of India: CJI NV Ramana
20.article_body: CJI NV Ramana, while hearing a Supreme Court (SC) petition, said there was a need for a debate on 'freebies' for the welfare of India. "Suppose the Centre makes a law that states cannot give freebies. Will such a law be open for judicial scrutiny?" he asked. He said there was a need to differentiate between 'freebies' and 'welfare schemes'.

21.title: Agencies shouldn't be used in wrong way: Warring on BB Ashu's arrest
21.article_body: Punjab Congress workers along with state chief Amarinder Singh Raja Warring on Tuesday protested against the arrest of party leader Bharat Bhushan Ashu and said agencies should not be used in the wrong way. "Ashu Ji's name wasn't even mentioned in the FIR," Warring said. "We're here at Punjab Vigilance Bureau office to ask why was he arrested," he added.

22.title: Illegal liquor factory busted in Jharkhand's Chatra, 4 arrested
22.article_body: An illegal liquor factory was busted and four inter-state smugglers were arrested in Jharkhand's Chatra on Tuesday, police said. The accused were operating the factory in a closed upgraded primary school premises, DSP Kedar Nath Ram said. Altogether 1,854 bottles of illicit liquor and liquor making materials were seized, he said, adding stickers of branded liquor companies were also seized.

23.title: 16-yr-old boy killed over love affair in UP's Barabanki, 3 held
23.article_body: Police on Tuesday said three men were arrested for allegedly killing a 16-year-old boy over a love affair in Uttar Pradesh's Barabanki. Suraj Chauhan's body was found on a barb wire in a field on Monday, police added. Chauhan's uncle accused Kallu, Farid and Abid of killing him as he was in love with a girl from their family.

24.title: Mizoram Police seizes heroin worth ₹13.4 crore, 2 arrested
24.article_body: Heroin weighing 2.7 kg worth ₹13.4 crore was recovered by Mizoram Police from Kawnpui town in Kolasib district near the border with Assam, police said in a statement. Two individuals who were allegedly found possessing the contraband were arrested on Monday, police added. According to police, one of the arrested persons is a Myanmar national.

25.title: Govt school teacher suspended for molesting girls on campus in Raj
25.article_body: A government school teacher in Rajasthan's Bharatpur was suspended for allegedly molesting girls on the school campus, officials said on Tuesday. As per reports, local residents blocked roads and barricaded the area as they demanded action against the accused. "I have had a word with the girls. They confirmed the sad incident," District Education Officer Raghunath Khatik said.

26.title: PM to inaugurate ₹660 cr cancer hospital in New Chandigarh on Wed
26.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to inaugurate the Homi Bhabha Cancer Hospital and Research Centre in New Chandigarh, Punjab, on Wednesday. According to the Health Ministry, the 300-bed hospital has been built by the Centre at a cost of over ₹660 crore and is equipped with modern facilities to treat all types of cancers using every available treatment modality.

27.title: US Embassy issues security alert in Ukraine, urges US citizens to leave
27.article_body: The US Embassy in Kyiv has warned of an increased possibility of Russian military strikes on Ukraine in the coming days around Ukrainian independence day and urged US citizens there to leave if they can. Earlier, Ukraine banned public celebrations in the capital on the anniversary of independence from Soviet rule on Wednesday, citing a heightened threat of attack.

28.title: South Africa, Australia firm favorites to play WTC final: Chopra
28.article_body: Former India batter Aakash Chopra has said that Australia and South Africa are currently the "firm favourites" to play the World Test Championship final in 2023. "Even if Australia win six out of their remaining nine Tests, they will end up on 68.4% (winning percentage), which is marginally ahead of India. This is a major problem," Chopra said.

29.title: 5 Chinese aircraft crossed Taiwan Strait median line, says Taipei
29.article_body: Five Chinese aircraft crossed the Taiwan Strait median line on Tuesday, the Taiwanese defence ministry said. The aircraft were among the 20 Chinese aircraft found operating in Taiwan's vicinity, the ministry informed. China has stepped up military activity around Taiwan since US House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi's Taipei visit that took place earlier this month.

30.title: His 'King' title: Deverakonda on a thing he wants to steal from SRK
30.article_body: Vijay Deverakonda in an interview was asked a thing he would want to steal from Shah Rukh Khan, to which he replied, "His King title." The actor, who'll soon be seen in 'Liger', further said he is in no hurry to sign films. "[After] Liger, I'll take some time and listen to stuff and...figure out what I want," Vijay added.

31.title: Govt sacks 3 IAF officers over accidental firing of BrahMos missile into Pakistan
31.article_body: The Centre has sacked three officers of the Indian Air Force (IAF) with immediate effect while holding them responsible for the March 2022 incident where a BrahMos missile misfired, the IAF said. The terminated officers- a Group Captain, a Wing Commander and a Squadron Leader- deviated from SOPs, IAF said. The weapon was accidentally fired into an area in Pakistan.

32.title: Ran away from home at 22, returned only when I became famous: Shehnaaz
32.article_body: Actress Shehnaaz Gill in an interview recalled running away from her home at the age of 22 to pursue her dreams in the entertainment industry. "They'd keep calling me, but I'd put the phone numbers of my family on a blocked list," she added. Shehnaaz further said she returned home only when she became famous.

33.title: Didn't eat meat the day I visited temple: Ex-K'taka CM Siddaramaiah amid controversy
33.article_body: Reacting to Karnataka BJP's allegation that ex-CM and Congress leader Siddaramaiah visited a temple after eating a non-vegetarian meal, he said he didn't eat meat on that day. "Is eating meat an issue?...I eat both meat and vegetarian food, it's my habit," he said. Siddaramaiah added, "Though there was chicken curry, I ate only bamboo shoot curry and 'akki rotti'."

34.title: 'Laal Singh Chaddha' becomes highest-grossing Hindi film at int'l box office in 2022
34.article_body: Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha' has become the highest-grossing Hindi film at the international box office in 2022. With earnings of $7.5 million so far at the international box office, 'Laal Singh Chaddha' has surpassed 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' ($7.47 million), 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' ($5.88 million), and 'The Kashmir Files' ($5.7 million).

35.title: India successfully flight tests VL-SRSAM missile system
35.article_body: Indian Navy and Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) successfully flight-tested indigenously designed and developed Vertical Launch Short Range Surface-to-Air Missile (VL-SRSAM) off Odisha's coast. "The missiles, equipped with indigenous Radio Frequency seeker, intercepted the target with high accuracy," Defence Ministry said. The launch was monitored by scientists from DRDO labs.

36.title: Bengaluru's Banashankari temple to be revamped at cost of ₹48 crore
36.article_body: Bengaluru's Sri Banashankari Amma Temple is expected to be revamped at an estimated cost of ₹48 crore. Karnataka minister Shashikala Jolle, after her visit to the temple on Monday, ordered officials to submit a detailed master plan for the overall development of the premises. A permanent roof, 'prasad' distribution counter and seats should be constructed for devotees' convenience, Jolle said.

37.title: Playing Rafael Nadal at US Open would be a nightmare: Nick Kyrgios
37.article_body: On being asked whom he would want to face at Arthur Ashe Stadium in New York ahead of US Open 2022, world number 26 Nick Kyrgios said, "I don't really want to play any of the 'Big 3', you know." He added, "Played Novak Djokovic, I don't want to see him again. Rafael Nadal would be a nightmare there."

38.title: Aadhaar verification now permitted for 8 online Delhi govt services
38.article_body: The Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) has permitted the Delhi government's industries department to accept the Aadhaar card for eight online services. The services include conversion to freehold, the permission of mortgage, application for possession, change of constitution, extending construction time, due payment and refund requests. The Aadhaar-based authentication is voluntary.

39.title: WTC Noida gets 'Premier Accredited Member' status
39.article_body: World Trade Center (WTC), Noida on Tuesday announced it was given the 'Premier Accredited Member' status by the World Trade Centers Association (WTCA). The WTCA is a global network of over 300 mutually supportive businesses across around 100 countries. "The requirements for this program are quite rigorous...could not be more proud of our members," said WTCA Chair, Board of Directors.

40.title: Maharashtra businessman offers Vinod Kambli job with ₹1 lakh per month salary
40.article_body: A Maharashtra businessman named Sandeep Thorat has offered former cricketer Vinod Kambli a job with a salary of ₹1 lakh per month. As per reports, Kambli has been offered a job in the finance division of the Sahyadri Industry Group in Mumbai. This comes after Kambli's interview went viral, wherein he talked about how he is undergoing a financial crunch.

41.title: Woman to sue Nick Kyrgios for accusing her of having 700 drinks at Wimbledon final
41.article_body: The woman, who Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios accused of having 700 drinks during the Wimbledon final, is going to sue Kyrgios for defamation. She stated that Kyrgios defamed her by making "a reckless and entirely baseless allegation". She has instructed her solicitors to start legal proceedings against Kyrgios if he does not offer "a prompt resolution to this matter".

42.title: Time most important thing in construction, govt is not taking decisions on time: Gadkari
42.article_body: While addressing 'NATCON 2022' organised by the Association of Consulting Civil Engineers, Mumbai, Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari said, "Time is the most important thing in construction. Time is the biggest capital." He added, "The biggest problem is [that] the government is not taking decisions on time." Gadkari was dropped from BJP's Parliamentary Board last week.

43.title: Want to remake Mahesh Babu’s 'Businessman' in Hindi: Puri Jagannadh
43.article_body: Director Puri Jagannadh said he wants to remake Mahesh Babu's 'Businessman' in Hindi as he feels it will have "great potential in the Hindi belts". He said that in the early 2010s, he had the idea to turn 'Businessman' and his popular film 'Pokiri' into franchises. However, the idea never took off as Mahesh was busy with other projects.

44.title: Not afraid of CBI, I'm an honest person: Delhi Dy CM Manish Sisodia
44.article_body: While addressing a gathering in poll-bound Gujarat's Bhavnagar, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said that he's an honest person who's not afraid of CBI. "In Delhi, [AAP has] given 2 lakh government jobs...This growing enthusiasm among people across the country [has made] CBI tighten the noose on me," he said. Sisodia's facing a CBI probe in an alleged liquor scam.

45.title: FIRs filed on complaints of JNU student, staff after clash in campus
45.article_body: Two FIRs have been registered after students and security guards clashed in Delhi's Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) on Monday. The FIRs have been lodged on separate complaints of a student and JNU's chief security officer under Sections 323 and 34 of IPC, among others. Students involved in the clash over scholarship funds were led by Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP).

46.title: We will see who will stop us: Vijay Deverakonda on #BoycottLiger trend
46.article_body: Reacting to the #BoycottLigerMovie trend on Twitter, actor Vijay Deverakonda said, "We've mother's blessings, people's love, god's support, a fire inside us, we'll see who'll stop us!" He stated, "With Liger we expected a bit of drama...but we'll fight. We've put our heart into making this film. And I believe...I'm correct. I feel that there is no room for fear."

47.title: My no-kissing policy on screen is for life: Actress Jannat Zubair
47.article_body: Actress Jannat Zubair has said that she would follow the 'no-kissing policy' for life. She said her policy is also the reason why she is not focusing on OTT at all. "If it wasn't a well-thought plan, I don't think it would have made to the headlines," she said. Jannat is currently seen on 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12'.

48.title: Pak killed their chances for WTC final by not producing good wickets: Chopra
48.article_body: Former India cricketer Aakash Chopra commented on Pakistan's chances to qualify for the World Test Championship final in 2023. "Pakistan have home series against England and New Zealand...But they killed their chances by not producing good wickets when they hosted Australia," Chopra said. He added, "If you continue to prepare such wickets then you won't win."

49.title: Man complains against Zomato for cancelling pizza order in Chandigarh, gets ₹10,000
49.article_body: Zomato has been told to pay ₹10,000 and serve a free meal to a Chandigarh customer who filed a complaint with the State Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission over a cancelled pizza order. The penalty was levied since the man, who ordered pizza for his children around 10 pm, was "deprived of food at late night hours", the order said.

50.title: CWG 2022 bronze medallists Treesa-Gayatri reach World C'ships second round
50.article_body: CWG 2022 bronze medal-winning shuttlers Treesa Jolly and Gayatri Gopichand reached the second round in women's doubles at World Championships 2022 after defeating the Malaysian duo of Low Yeen Yuan and Valeree Siow 21-11, 21-13 in Tokyo on Tuesday. India's Ishaan Bhatnagar and Tanisha Crasto lost to Thailand's Supak Jomkoh and Supissara Paewsampran 14-21, 17-21 in mixed doubles second round.

51.title: B'luru man dies after motorcycle hits pothole, case filed against BBMP
51.article_body: A 44-year-old man recently fell off his motorcycle after the vehicle hit a pothole in Bengaluru near Sunkadakatte area. Supreeth, who had received head injuries, died on Monday, less than a week after the accident. His brother has filed a police report against authorities of Bengaluru civic body BBMP, charging them with failing to patch potholes and maintain the road.

52.title: 65-year-old man dies of electrocution in Thane
52.article_body: A 65-year-old man died of electrocution in the Upavan area of Thane, Maharashtra. The victim, Bhurao Narayan Chavan, was driving a truck when he noticed a two-wheeler parked in the way, an official said. Chavan got out to move the two-wheeler aside when he came in contact with a metal plate protruding from a distribution panel box, he added.

53.title: Adani to indirectly buy 29% stake in NDTV, launch open offer for another 26%
53.article_body: Adani Group's AMG Media Networks Limited (AMNL) will indirectly buy a 29.18% stake in NDTV and will launch an open offer for a further 26% stake at ₹294/share, the group said in a statement. Calling the acquisition offer "a significant milestone" for AMNL, its CEO and Editor-in-Chief Sanjay Pugalia said, "We look forward to strengthening NDTV's leadership in news delivery."

54.title: 3 petrol pump workers injured as robbers attack them with axe in Pune
54.article_body: Three employees sustained injuries after two masked men attacked them with the blunt side of an axe during an armed robbery at a petrol pump in Pune's Narhe in the early hours of Tuesday. The accused looted ₹20,400 in cash. The incident took place when the filling station was closed and some employees were sleeping in the manager's cabin.

55.title: 3 of family killed, 2 injured as car crashes into tree in UP's Budaun
55.article_body: Police said three members of a family were killed and two others were injured on Tuesday when their car crashed into a tree in Uttar Pradesh's Budaun. The accident took place around 2 am when they were returning from Khatu Shyam temple in Budaun, police added. The deceased were identified as 28-year-old Jyoti alias Ruchi, eight-year-old Shashank and 24-year-old Priyank.

56.title: India awaits evidence from Russia over IS bomber's arrest: Officials
56.article_body: India is awaiting formal sharing of evidence from Russia on the Islamic State (IS) suicide bomber who was arrested in Russia after being accused of plotting an attack in India, government officials have reportedly said. The NIA could step in to probe the matter if Russia hands over conclusive proof, officials said. The terrorist was recruited in Turkey, Russia said.

57.title: 'Bharat Jodo' is the need of the hour: Congress' Jairam Ramesh
57.article_body: Ahead of Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' from September 7, party MP Jairam Ramesh on Tuesday said it is the need of the hour. "Inflation, GST, unemployment are breaking India. Social polarisation is being done in the name of religion, caste, language, food, clothes," Jairam Ramesh said. "In politics, Centre is overpowering," he added.

58.title: I-T Dept raids offices of real estate firm Phoenix Group in Hyd
58.article_body: Income Tax Department conducted raids on offices of real estate company Phoenix Group and the residences of its Directors in Hyderabad on Tuesday. Nearly 200 income tax officials had flown in from Mumbai to conduct raids at 20 locations over alleged tax evasion. The company's Chairman Emeritus Suresh Chukkapalli is alleged to have close relations with Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS).

59.title: Rupali highest-paid actor on 'Anupamaa', charges ₹60,000 per episode: Reports
59.article_body: Rupali Ganguly is reportedly the highest-paid actor on the show 'Anupamaa'. Ganguly, who plays the titular role, charges ₹60,000 per episode while Sudhanshu Pandey, who essays the role of Vanraj Shah, charges ₹50,000 per episode, as per reports. Actress Madalsa Sharma, who stars as Kavya, gets ₹30,000 per episode, reports further said.

60.title: 2 minor sisters consume poison after being scolded by brother in UP, die
60.article_body: Two girls died after consuming poison in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly district, police said on Tuesday. The girls, aged 15 and 16 years, reportedly took the decision after being scolded by their brother. While one of them died on the way to the hospital, the other passed away during treatment on Monday evening, Bareilly Additional SP (Rural) Raj Kumar said.

61.title: Improve your service or lose licence: Pune RTO to 35 driving schools
61.article_body: The Pune Regional Transport Office (RTO) has warned at least 35 driving schools to upgrade their services or risk losing their licences. The RTO's comments came after the schools performed poorly in their evaluation tests conducted to check their infrastructure. The schools have been given until August-end to improve services, following which there will be a re-inspection, an official said.

62.title: I used to call Deepak Hooda 'coach killer' in his U-19 days: R Sridhar
62.article_body: Ex-India fielding coach R Sridhar has revealed that he used to call Deepak Hooda a "coach killer" during the all-rounder's Under-19 days. "Deepak used to come up and ask, 'Sir, let's do a power-hitting session'...[and] we used to tell him, 'No Deepak, you're not coming because you're hitting the balls into Cubbon Park...we're losing expensive white kookaburra balls'," recalled Sridhar.

63.title: I'd bracket him with the likes of Rohit, Kohli, Rahul: Harbhajan on Shubman
63.article_body: Praising Shubman Gill, who was adjudged 'Player of the Series' in India's 3-0 ODI series whitewash over Zimbabwe, Harbhajan Singh said the Indian opener is a sorted batter having a sound technique and very good shot selection. "In terms of batsmanship, I'd bracket him with the likes of Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli and KL Rahul in...current Indian team," he added.

64.title: Most countries agree with our proposal on Iran nuclear deal: EU
64.article_body: Most countries involved in talks to revive the 2015 nuclear deal with Iran agree with EU's proposal in the matter, EU's foreign policy chief Josep Borrell said on Tuesday. A response by the US on the proposal is expected this week, Borrell added. He further informed that Iran has sought some adjustments in EU's "final text" submitted earlier this month.

65.title: Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain's wife gets bail in money laundering case
65.article_body: A Delhi court on Tuesday granted bail to Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain's wife Poonam Jain in a money laundering case. She was granted interim bail in the case on August 6 after the court held that she wasn't arrested during the investigation and the ED had already filed a chargesheet. Satyendar Jain's bail plea will be heard on August 27.

66.title: Jharkhand woman set on fire by man for not speaking to him
66.article_body: A 19-year-old woman was allegedly set on fire by a man for not speaking to him in Jharkhand's Dumka district. The accused, Shahrukh, has been arrested and used to pester the girl to become his friend, police said. Shahrukh, who is a construction worker, set the girl on fire by allegedly pouring petrol on her on Tuesday morning, police added.

67.title: Baltic states, Poland & Finland could ban Russian tourists: Lithuania
67.article_body: Baltic nations, Latvia, Lithuania and Estonia, along with Poland and Finland may stop Russian tourists from entering their countries if European Union does not enact a union-wide ban, Lithuania's Foreign Minister Gabrielius Landsbergis said. All these countries share a border with Russia. "Russian tourists shouldn't be in the European Union...[Russia] is undertaking genocide," Landsbergis added.

68.title: Ananya seeks blessings at Gurudwara Bangla Sahib ahead of Liger's release
68.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday, who will next be seen in 'Liger', visited Gurudwara Bangla Sahib in Delhi to seek blessings for her upcoming film. She took to Instagram to share some pictures from her visit, and wrote, "Satnam Waheguru...Waheguru ji ka Khalsa Waheguru ji ki fateh." The film, scheduled to release in theatres on August 25, will also feature Vijay Deverakonda.

69.title: I'm one of Shubman's biggest fans, that's why I got his shirt: Brad Evans
69.article_body: Zimbabwe all-rounder Brad Evans has said he's one of the biggest fans of India batter Shubman Gill and that's why he asked for the 22-year-old's shirt after their final ODI on Monday. "I just sometimes watch Shubman in awe 'this guy is so good'...I watched him in the IPL and in Australia when they won that Test series," added Evans.

70.title: India's biggest problem is picking their best 11: Zimbabwe head coach
70.article_body: Zimbabwe head coach Dave Houghton said Team India's biggest problem in international cricket is picking their best 11. "How many people do you play with?" added Houghton. "The toughest job in India will be to pick your final 15 for the World Cup because you could pick 50 and...decide to play with the 11 who're good as anybody," he stated.

71.title: No political vendetta: Punjab CM after Cong leader BB Ashu's arrest
71.article_body: After Punjab Congress Working President and former minister Bharat Bhushan Ashu was arrested on corruption charges, Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann said there was no political vendetta behind his arrest. "Law is doing its work," Mann said. "We promised...people that action will be taken against those who looted Punjab and this arrest is part of that," he added.

72.title: 2 college students & driver killed, 7 injured in road accident in MP
72.article_body: Two college students and their van driver died while seven others were injured after a truck hit their vehicle in Madhya Pradesh's Burhanpur district on Tuesday, police said. The accident occurred on Indore-Ichhapur highway, Superintendent of Police Rahul Kumar said. While the girls and the van driver died on the spot, the injured were admitted to district hospital, he added.

73.title: My commitment will be based on our int'l schedule: Stokes on playing in IPL
73.article_body: England Test captain Ben Stokes has said he'll be playing the franchise cricket only after considering England's international schedule. "I've played in the IPL for four years. I've loved it every time...but as I said there's a schedule to be looked at around the window of the IPL," he added. Stokes had opted out of the IPL 2022 mega auction.

74.title: upGrad increases ESOP pool size for second time in a year
74.article_body: Edtech unicorn upGrad increased the pool size of its employee stock option plan (ESOP) with fresh options for the second time in the last one year. According to a regulatory filing, upGrad enlarged its ESOP pool by 3,00,000 options or 13%, to 25.25 lakh from its existing 22.25 lakh options. In November 2021, upGrad increased its ESOP pool by 28%

75.title: Logistics service provider Rivigo raises $2 mn in Series H round
75.article_body: Gurugram-based logistics service provider Rivigo has raised $2 million in its Series H funding round. The round was led by Elevation Capital and Warburg Pincus affiliate Spring Canter Investment. As per a regulatory filing, the startup issued 11,840 Series H compulsorily convertible preference shares to both Elevation Capital and Spring Canter. In December 2019, the firm raised $20 million.

76.title: 7 arrested by CBI in Bogtui Rampurhat killing case in WB's Birbhum
76.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Tuesday arrested seven persons in Bogtui Rampurhat killing case in West Bengal's Birbhum district. The accused will be produced before a court in Rampurhat on Tuesday, a CBI official said. In March, at least 10 people, including women and children, were killed after unidentified miscreants set several houses in the village on fire.

77.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
77.article_body: As per IMD, heavy to very heavy rainfall is likely over north Gujarat and south Rajasthan on Tuesday. IMD added that heavy to very heavy rainfall is also likely over Odisha, Kerala and Mahe on August 23 and 24. Strong surface winds (speed reaching 20-30 kmph gusting to 40 kmph) are likely over southeast Rajasthan and west Madhya Pradesh.

78.title: Covered wall with photos of killers, Akshay was very happy: Cuttputlli maker
78.article_body: Filmmaker Ranjit M Tewari, who's directed Akshay Kumar's film 'Cuttputlli', where he plays a cop, said they covered his room with over 500 photos and newspaper cuttings of real serial killers. "His character's obsessed with the...world of serial killing," he added. "When Akshay...saw...he was very happy with the detailing," he stated, adding they put photos of killers like Ted Bundy.

79.title: BS Yediyurappa launches 'Savarkar Rath Yatra' in Mysore
79.article_body: Former Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa launched the Savarkar Rath Yatra in Mysore with the slogan 'Bharat Mata ki Jai'. He claimed that former PM Indira Gandhi had called Savarkar “the remarkable son” and had also issued stamps in his memory. “I am saddened by the controversy over Savarkar in Karnataka who was called Veer by Indira Gandhi,” Yediyurappa said.

80.title: List steps taken to rescue child beggars: Delhi HC to authorities
80.article_body: The Delhi HC has directed the Centre, city government and Delhi Commission for Protection of Child Rights to list steps they've taken to rescue child beggars. The court has given the authorities eight weeks to disclose measures taken by them zone-wise in the entire city. The court's remarks come in response to a public interest litigation filed on the matter.

81.title: UK denies meddling in Kenyan Presidential election
81.article_body: UK High Commissioner Jane Marriott dismissed claims that she and UK interfered in Kenya's recently-concluded Presidential election. She was reacting to allegations that she pressured the electoral commission to declare William Ruto as President-elect following the disputed poll. Some social media users also shared unverified photos of her shaking hands with Ruto and the electoral body chairperson.

82.title: Pune activists demand removal of mobile immersion tanks for Ganesh Chaturthi
82.article_body: Activists in Pune have demanded that the mobile immersion tanks used during the Ganesh Chaturthi festival be discontinued. They said that incurring expenditure on these tanks was unnecessary and "a complete waste of money". The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) had introduced mobile immersion tanks during the pandemic-induced lockdown to avoid crowding during the Ganesh Chaturthi festival.

83.title: Miss you so much, it hurts: KK's wife on his birth anniversary
83.article_body: Late singer KK's wife Jyothy Krishna and his daughter Tamara Krishna remembered the singer on his 54th birth anniversary. Jyothy shared a throwback photo and wrote, "Miss you so much, it hurts", while Tamara shared how she missed waking up and eating birthday cake with KK. Tamara also promised KK that she is "not gonna let mom feel sad today".

84.title: India simply have to beat Aus 4-0 when they host them in 2023: Aakash
84.article_body: Commentator Aakash Chopra said India "simply" have to beat Australia 4-0 when they host the latter in 2023, in order to reach the final of the ongoing edition of the World Test Championship (WTC). "If India win 4-0, they will rise in the standings. They will need to rise otherwise they will find themselves in a precarious situation," added Aakash.

85.title: KCR worried seeing support BJP is getting: Nadda after BJP T'gana chief detained
85.article_body: Soon after Telangana Police detained BJP state chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar in Jangaon, BJP National President JP Nadda said CM K Chandrashekar Rao is worried seeing the massive support that BJP is receiving from all corners of the state against his "corrupt and family-centric regime". "I strongly condemn the illegal arrest of…Bandi Sanjay by the TRS government," Nadda added.

86.title: B'luru woman kills 4-yr-old daughter, attempts to kill self but survives
86.article_body: A woman killed her four-year-old daughter in Bengaluru. She later attempted to kill herself too. However, she survived after her husband took her to the hospital. Police recovered a suicide note in which the woman said that she was unable to handle even trivial issues and she had developed suicidal thoughts.

87.title: Video of woman's rape posted by Italian PM candidate on Twitter, sparks criticism
87.article_body: Far-right Italian politician Giorgia Meloni, who is leading the race to be the next PM of Italy, sparked criticism after she tweeted a video of a woman being raped. Meloni shared a blurred clip of a man assaulting a 55-year-old Ukrainian woman on a pavement, saying she 'couldn't remain silent'. Twitter removed the video on Tuesday, after widespread backlash.

88.title: 15-yr-old complains of stomach ache, delivers baby later; rape case filed
88.article_body: A rape case was registered against a man in Rajasthan after a 15-year-old girl delivered a baby boy. Police said the girl complained of stomach ache, after which she was admitted to a district hospital. "Diagnosis revealed that she was pregnant," police added. In another such case, a 15-year-old girl delivered a baby girl. However, the baby did not survive.

89.title: Thousands protest across Haiti, demand PM Henry's resignation
89.article_body: Thousands of protesters in Haiti's capital Port-au-Prince and other major cities blocked roads, shut down businesses and marched through the streets on Monday, demanding PM Ariel Henry's resignation and calling for a better quality of life. Protesters were heard chanting, "If Ariel doesn't leave, we're going to die." This comes amid rising gang violence and soaring consumer prices.

90.title: Minor girl can marry on attaining puberty, stay with husband under Muslim law: HC
90.article_body: While granting protection to Muslim couple, Delhi High Court observed that as per Mohammedan Law, a minor girl who had attained the age of puberty could marry without parents' consent. It added that she also has "right to reside with her husband even when she was less than 18 years of age". The girl's parents had opposed the marriage.

91.title: Mehbooba Mufti's sister gets bailable warrant in 1989 abduction case
91.article_body: Terrorist and Disruptive Activities (Prevention) Act, 1987 (TADA) court issued a bailable warrant against Mehbooba Mufti's sister Rubaiya Sayeed in the 1989 abduction case. "Rubaiya was summoned...She was supposed to be present for cross-examination, but she did not appear," a senior CBI lawyer said. Rubaiya was abducted by Jammu Kashmir Liberation Front (JKLF) militants on December 8, 1989.

92.title: Congress attempts to pacify Anand Sharma ahead of Himachal polls
92.article_body: UPA Chairperson Sonia Gandhi asked the AICC in-charge of Himachal Pradesh, Rajeev Shukla, to pacify the situation after senior leader Anand Sharma resigned from his position as Congress' Steering Committee Chairman for the state. “It is our duty to meet Anand Sharma. We have good relations with him and he is dedicated to the party,” said Shukla after meeting Sharma.

93.title: Locals march with torches in knee-deep water over waterlogging in Raj
93.article_body: Residents of Rajasthan's Sikar on Monday carried out torch rally against the administration over the issue of waterlogging due to heavy rainfall in the Nawalgarh Road area. A video of the rally purportedly shows people marching in knee-deep water and shouting slogans against the administration. Waterlogging at Nawalgarh Road has reportedly disrupted traffic movement and affected people's lives.

94.title: K'taka govt spent ₹37 lakh on 'Modi@20' book launch event: Report
94.article_body: An RTI response revealed that Karnataka government spent ₹37 lakh to organise an event launching a book on PM Narendra Modi, a report said. 'Modi@20: Dreams Meet Delivery' was launched in Bengaluru in June 2022. As per the response, ₹12,38,674 was spent on digital media management and ₹1,10,000 was spent on providing 100 Mbps internet speed for the three-hour event.

95.title: Malaysian top court upholds ex-PM's jail term in corruption case
95.article_body: Malaysia's top court on Tuesday upheld former PM Najib Razak's 2020 conviction in the 1Malaysia Development Berhad (1MDB) corruption case. Razak had been found guilty of misappropriating funds worth $9.4 million from SRC International, a former subsidiary of Malaysia's sovereign wealth fund 1MDB, among other charges. The 12-year prison sentence handed to Razak in 2020 was also upheld on Tuesday.

96.title: AAP should expose BJP's attempts to topple Delhi government: NCP
96.article_body: The NCP asked AAP to "expose" BJP's attempts to topple the Delhi government. This comes after AAP leader Manish Sisodia claimed BJP offered to drop all cases against him if he joined the saffron party. "There was talk of similar offers...in Maharashtra and eventually...MVA government fell. AAP [say] they have...recording of the 'offer', why wait"? NCP spokesman Clyde Crasto said.

97.title: Rakesh Tikait is a 'second rate person': Union Minister Ajay Misra
97.article_body: Union Minister Ajay Misra Teni has called farmer leader Rakesh Tikait a "second rate person". "I know Tikait very well, he is a 'do kaudi ka aadmi' (second rate person). He fought election twice and lost the deposit," Teni said. He added, "If this kind of a man opposes anyone, it is of no value."

98.title: So close yet so far: Raza on Zimbabwe's 13-run loss in 3rd ODI vs India
98.article_body: Following Zimbabwe's 13-run loss in the third ODI against India in Harare, Zimbabwe all-rounder Sikandar Raza said, "So close yet so far! It really hurts when you get this close and not cross the line." Chasing 290, Zimbabwe were bowled out for 276 in 49.3 overs. Raza scored a 95-ball 115. India whitewashed Zimbabwe 3-0 in the ODI series.

99.title: I'm disconnected from social media, toxic material there: Naga Chaitanya
99.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya has stated that he is very disconnected from social media, adding that he is a boring person online. "Around my film releases, I'm reading...conversations, reviews and reactions [more than posting]," the actor added. He further said that he doesn't attach himself too much to it because there is a lot of toxic material online.

100.title: Taiwan saw off China before, retains will to defend itself: Prez Tsai
100.article_body: Taiwan's President Tsai Ing-wen said on Tuesday that Taiwan had warded off China's military six decades ago, adding that it has retained the resolve to defend its territory to date. She made these remarks in front of a visiting group of ex-US officials. China conducted several drills around Taiwan following US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's recent visit to the island.

101.title: RBI has set 2-yr target to bring down inflation to 4%: Governor Das
101.article_body: Reserve Bank of India Governor Shaktikanta Das said on Tuesday that the central bank has set a two-year timeframe to bring down inflation to 4%. "We will approach the 4% inflation target in a steady manner, without much of a growth sacrifice," Das said. There is "absolutely no room" for any complacency with regards to inflation, he further said.

102.title: Man who pushed wife in front of moving train in Maharashtra arrested
102.article_body: A man who killed his wife by pushing her in front of a moving train at the Vasai Road Railway Station in Maharashtra on Monday was arrested in Thane. After pushing his wife, the man ran away from the platform with his two children. The incident was caught on a CCTV camera installed at the platform of the station.

103.title: Gujarat BJP chief is going to be removed soon, according to sources: Kejriwal
103.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said that BJP in Gujarat is "terrified" because of AAP. "According to the sources, soon, Gujarat BJP chief CR Paatil is going to be removed. Is the BJP so afraid?" Kejriwal tweeted. CM Kejriwal and his deputy Manish Sisodia arrived in poll-bound Gujarat for a two-day visit on Monday.

104.title: Delhi man arrested for creating fake social media profile of woman
104.article_body: A 32-year-old man was arrested by Delhi's Dwarka Police for allegedly creating a fake social media profile of a woman after she ignored his messages. The accused, Mahaveer Singh, used to then send obscene messages to the woman, police said. Notably, Mahaveer's brother used to reside in the same building as the complainant around eight-nine years ago, police added

105.title: UP Police raid illegal hookah bar in Greater Noida, 25 arrested
105.article_body: UP Police raided a bar at a mall in Greater Noida for allegedly serving hookah to customers without permission. "We have busted an illegal hookah bar at Lucifer restaurant and bar. Over 15 hookahs and pipes have been seized from the property. We have apprehended 25 persons," said Deputy Commissioner of Police, Greater Noida.

106.title: Real B'wood found in dark alleys, those who make it get into drugs: Vivek
106.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri recently shared an "inside story" on Bollywood on social media, writing, "What you see is not Bollywood. Real Bollywood is found in its dark alleys." He further wrote, "Those who find some success but not the real one get into drugs, alcohol...Some success is the most dangerous one. You are in showbiz without any income and power."

107.title: Actor Aayush Sharma announces next film, shares first look
107.article_body: Actor Aayush Sharma took to Instagram and shared his first look from his upcoming film. The film is yet to be titled and the name of the director is yet to be revealed. "If I provide all the details now, it will ruin all the fun," Aayush captioned it. The actor further revealed that the film will release in 2023.

108.title: There's no place at the top, Sanju can stake claim at no. 5 or 6: Kaif
108.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif has said Sanju Samson's six-hitting ability can help him stake a claim down the batting order in India's playing XI. "There's no place at the top. You have KL Rahul [and] Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli will come and Suryakumar Yadav is also there," stated Kaif. Samson batted at number six in the Zimbabwe ODIs.

109.title: Delhi likely to see very light rainfall with overcast skies: IMD
109.article_body: The India Meteorological Department has predicted very light rainfall with overcast skies in Delhi today. The national capital could also see strong gusty winds with a speed of 35-45km/hr. According to Met officials, the maximum temperature may hover around 35°C, while the minimum will be around 27°C. Delhi’s air quality (92) was in the satisfactory category this morning.

110.title: I respect SRK a lot, can never make fun of him: Munawar Faruqui
110.article_body: Comedian Munawar Faruqui has said that he respects Shah Rukh Khan a lot and can never make fun of him. "Even after so much name and fame, he has a very distinct attraction. You cannot help but admire him," he added. Calling Shah Rukh a sharp and witty man, Munawar said, "He has an amazing hold on stage. It's fantastic."

111.title: Obviously a difficult feeling: Harry Styles on trolling against Olivia
111.article_body: Singer Harry Styles opened up about the trolling against his girlfriend Olivia Wilde. "It's obviously a difficult feeling to feel like being close to me means you're at the ransom of a corner of Twitter," he said. He added, "I just wanted to sing. I didn't want to get into it if I was going to hurt people like that."

112.title: Shivnath Express train derails in Chhattisgarh, no casualty reported
112.article_body: The Shivnath Express train, which was heading to Nagpur, got derailed in Chhattisgarh’s Dongargarh this morning. The train was on its way from Gondia station to Itwari in Nagpur. The incident took place early morning at 3:42 am. According to an official, there has been no casualty or injury reported as the train was travelling at quite a slow pace.

113.title: Congolese woman held in Delhi for cheating Pune resident of ₹12.3 lakh
113.article_body: A Congolese woman, wanted by Pimpri Chinchwad Police in a case of cyber fraud since 2021, was arrested upon landing at Delhi airport. She allegedly cheated a 40-year-old woman of ₹12.3 lakh through an online dating portal by using a fake profile of a US-based surgeon. A Look Out Circular was issued against her and she was detained in Delhi.

114.title: Jhunjhunwala's Rare Enterprises-backed IKS Health to file for IPO: Reports
114.article_body: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala’s investment firm Rare Enterprises-backed IKS Health is set to file draft papers with the Securities and Exchange Board of India in September for floating initial public offering (IPO) soon, reports said. IKS Health is reportedly looking to raise ₹2,500 crore via the issuance of 15% equity. Rare Enterprises hold a nearly 54% stake in IKS Health.

115.title: Enjoyed calling Anil nanaji after arrival of Sonam's baby: Sanjay Kapoor
115.article_body: Actor Sanjay Kapoor, brother of Anil Kapoor, said in an interview that he enjoyed calling Anil 'nanaji' after the arrival of Sonam Kapoor's baby. "He laughed and said grandfather sounds cooler," Sanjay added. He further said Sonam and her husband Anand Ahuja were 'ecstatic'. Sonam and Anand became parents on August 20.

116.title: Missed opportunity for scene with Pankaj in 'Criminal Justice 3': Purab
116.article_body: Actor Purab Kohli stated that it was a missed opportunity for him to get a scene with actor Pankaj Tripathi in their upcoming web show 'Criminal Justice: Adhura Sach'. "I mentioned it to director Rohan Sippy and the writer too. Requested them for at least one scene where I get to act with Pankaj...but that didn't happen sadly," he added.

117.title: Losing Shaheen before Asia Cup is a 'big' setback: Pak head coach Saqlain
117.article_body: Pakistan head coach Saqlain Mushtaq said losing pacer Shaheen Shah Afridi before the Asia Cup is a "big setback" for his team. "The injury [to his right knee ligament] is unfortunate," added Saqlain. "Shaheen's injury [is a] big relief for the Indian top-order [batters]," ex-Pakistan captain Waqar Younis had earlier tweeted. India will face Pakistan on August 28 in Dubai.

118.title: 4 earthquakes hit Jammu and Kashmir in less than 6 hours
118.article_body: As many as four earthquakes hit Jammu and Kashmir in less than six hours on Tuesday. The first earthquake occurred at 2.20 am and its epicentre was 61 kilometres east of the Katra area in Jammu, officials said. The second earthquake of 2.6-magnitude on the Richter scale occurred at 3.21 am, 9.5 kilometres northeast of Doda in Jammu.

119.title: 6 of family, including 11-yr-old, killed as car collides with bus in Tamil Nadu
119.article_body: At least six members of a family, including an 11-year-old girl, were killed in a road accident near Attur in Tamil Nadu's Salem, police said. The car they were travelling in collided with a bus on Salem-Chennai National Highway, police added. As many as 11 people had gone to attend the funeral of one of their relatives, police stated.

120.title: A heavy price would be paid for invading Taiwan: President Tsai amid China threat
120.article_body: Amid the threat of an invasion by China, Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen said, "A heavy price will be paid for invading or attempting to invade Taiwan, and it will be strongly condemned by the international community." "What we have to do is to let the enemy understand that Taiwan has the determination and preparation to defend the country," she added.

121.title: US urges citizens to leave Ukraine, says Russia planning fresh strikes
121.article_body: The US has said that Russia is planning to step up its attacks on Ukraine's civilian infrastructure and government buildings in the coming days. The US also urged its citizens to leave Ukraine immediately. This comes as Kyiv banned public celebrations to mark Ukraine's Independence Day, which falls on August 24, citing a heightened threat of attack from Russia.

122.title: BJP's 'Operation Lotus' in Delhi failed for 2nd time: AAP MLA
122.article_body: AAP MLA Saurabh Bharadwaj on Tuesday said that BJP has toppled several elected governments in the country under "Operation Lotus". "BJP's 'Operation Lotus' in Delhi failed for the second time," Bharadwaj added. "We will expose BJP in such a way that it will not dare to topple any government in any state in future," he stated.

123.title: IAF's Mi-35 attack helicopter makes emergency landing in Rajasthan
123.article_body: An Indian Air Force (IAF) Mi-35 helicopter made an emergency landing in a farm in Rajasthan's Hanumangarh district after it developed a technical snag on Tuesday. "The helicopter made the emergency landing due to a technical snag. Its crew members are safe," Station House Officer of Sangaria police station said.

124.title: Congress releases 'Mile kadam-Jude vatan' tagline for its Bharat Jodo Yatra
124.article_body: Ahead of Congress’ Bharat Jodo Yatra, which is scheduled to start on September 7 from Kanniyakumari, senior party leaders released the logo, tagline and pamphlet of the campaign in Delhi. The tagline reads 'Mile kadam-Jude vatan'. The five-month-long yatra is scheduled to cover a distance of 3,500 kilometres over 12 states. The party has also launched a website.

125.title: PIL filed in Calcutta HC seeking ban on Aamir's 'Laal Singh Chaddha'
125.article_body: A Public Interest Litigation (PIL) has been filed in Calcutta High Court against Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha' calling for a ban on the film in West Bengal. The PIL cites peace disorder stating that the Army is not represented properly in the film. It also calls for police personnel to be posted outside theatres if ban is not placed.

126.title: Assam court summons Sisodia over defamation case filed by CM Himanta
126.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has been summoned to appear before an Assam court on September 29 over a defamation case filed by Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma. Sarma filed the case after Sisodia accused him of corruption. Sisodia had alleged that the Assam government gave contracts to firms linked to Sarma's family to produce PPE kits at high prices.

127.title: Woman dies days after giving birth by C-section at Hyderabad hospital
127.article_body: A woman with hearing and speech issues died days after she gave birth to a baby through a caesarean procedure at a hospital in Hyderabad. The woman's family members have filed a complaint against the hospital. She gave birth on August 9 and suffered complications after that. She was readmitted to the hospital, where she died on August 20.

128.title: 'Convicts' release shows they were reformed,' says officer who probed Bilkis Bano case
128.article_body: The release of 11 convicts in the Bilkis Bano case shows they were reformed, said retired IPS officer Vivek Dube, who investigated the case. Dube, who was then the Joint Director at the CBI, added, "The protest by a section of people and media...have no basis. They are being revengeful, which is against the spirit of the Constitution of India."

129.title: US President's Chief Medical Advisor Fauci to step down after 50 yrs of govt service
129.article_body: White House Chief Medical Advisor Dr Anthony Fauci announced he will step down from his role in December, after over 50 years of government service. He will also step down from his role as head of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID). "I am very proud of our many accomplishments," said Dr Fauci.

130.title: ABVP protests near Hyd junior college, calls for fee regulatory law
130.article_body: Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP) held a protest in front of Hyderabad's Sri Chaitanya Junior College on Monday. Protesting against Telangana government's "soft attitude" against erring private junior colleges, the activists said that the state government should introduce a fee regulatory law for private colleges. ABVP also called for bandh of all junior colleges in Telangana on Tuesday.

131.title: ‘Bharat Jodo Yatra’ could lead to violence: BS Yediyurappa
131.article_body: Former Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa cautioned Congress against holding 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', asserting that it could lead to violence and unrest. "On the pretext of protesting, holding a padayatra is uncalled for. If the proposed padayatra is held, lakhs of people are likely to assemble which could spell a disaster. Siddaramaiah will be solely responsible for the problem," Yediyurappa said.

132.title: Karnataka govt to install 'unicorn' structure in Bengaluru
132.article_body: The Karnataka government announced on Monday that it would put up a 'unicorn' structure in Bengaluru to mark the city being home to the largest number of start-ups and unicorns in the country. According to the Crunchbase website, India saw 53 start-ups becoming unicorns between 2011 and 2022 and of these, 19 are said to be based in Bengaluru.

133.title: Billionaire Adani's empire may spiral into debt trap, is deeply overleveraged: Report
133.article_body: Indian billionaire Gautam Adani's empire is "deeply overleveraged" and risks spiralling into a debt trap and possibly a default "in the worst-case scenario", a report by a Fitch Group unit has said. It also warned that potential strong competition for market dominance between Adani Group and Mukesh Ambani's Reliance may lead to 'unwise' financial decisions.

134.title: Hindi cinema won't die, Bollywood not lacking anything: Manoj Bajpayee
134.article_body: Actor Manoj Bajpayee has stated in an interview that too much is being made out of Bollywood's bad phase, adding that Hindi cinema will not die. "It will course-correct and come back to its normal self," the actor said. On being asked if Bollywood is lacking something to attract audience, Manoj said, "We don't lack anything. We've been entertaining for...decades."

135.title: Only player who's probably disappointed with Zimbabwe ODIs is Rahul: Ajay Jadeja
135.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Ajay Jadeja has said the only cricketer who is probably disappointed with the recently-concluded Zimbabwe ODIs is KL Rahul. "He [Rahul] didn't get to bat enough and he has no one else to blame but himself," added Jadeja. Rahul scored a total of 31 runs in his two innings in the three-match series.

136.title: 2015 silver medallist Saina enters pre-quarters at World Championships 2022
136.article_body: Ex-world number one Saina Nehwal beat Hong Kong's Cheung Ngan Yi 21-19, 21-9 in the first round at World Championships 2022 in Tokyo on Tuesday. The 2015 silver medallist will now play her pre-quarterfinal match after her second round opponent Nozomi Okuhara withdrew from the tournament. Saina is the only Indian shuttler left in the women's singles category.

137.title: Disgraceful, condemnable: Mayawati on T'gana BJP MLA's remarks on Prophet
137.article_body: BSP chief Mayawati termed Telangana BJP MLA Raja Singh's remarks against Prophet Muhammad as "disgraceful and utterly condemnable". "Is it not the responsibility of...BJP leadership to keep its people restrained and controlled to maintain peace...besides saving the country's image from getting hurt abroad," she tweeted. Singh was arrested today following massive protests by people in Hyderabad.

138.title: Amit Shah calling T'gana CM 'anti-farmer' is joke of the century: KTR
138.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah calling Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao "anti-farmer" is the joke of the century, Telangana Rashtra Samithi Working President KT Rama Rao tweeted. "Who copied KCR's brainchild "Rythu Bandhu"...rebranded it as PM-Kisan?" KTR added. "Who apologised to the farmers after facing their wrath over the [repealed] farm laws, after losing 700 valuable lives?" he wrote.

139.title: 50-yr-old Mumbai man cheated of ₹17.3 lakh in bitcoin investment fraud
139.article_body: A 50-year-old man from Mumbai, Colin Buthello, lodged a complaint with Nehru Nagar police alleging he was defrauded of ₹17.30 lakh after investing in a bogus bitcoin trading company. According to police, the fraudster promised returns as high as 150%, after which the victim kept investing bigger amounts. However, the company's web link became dysfunctional and the fraudster stopped responding.

140.title: IndusInd Bank digital banking units launched in Punjab, Tamil Nadu
140.article_body: IndusInd Bank has launched two digital banking units to accelerate the reach of digital banking services. The units have been opened in Punjab and Tamil Nadu and will offer several "Digital, Do It Yourself" services, the bank said. The services include instant opening of savings and current accounts, instant processing of personal and business loans, and KYC updates, among others.

141.title: BJP suspends Telangana MLA Raja Singh after his arrest over Prophet remarks
141.article_body: BJP's Telangana MLA T Raja Singh was suspended by the party hours after he was arrested on Tuesday for allegedly making derogatory remarks against Prophet Muhammad. The party gave Singh a show-cause notice of 10 days, asking him to explain why he should not be expelled. An FIR was registered against him after protests erupted in Hyderabad on Monday.

142.title: Haarsh and I always wanted baby girl but God had his own plan: Bharti on son
142.article_body: Comedian Bharti Singh said that she and her husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa wanted a baby girl from the beginning. "But God had his own plan and blessed us with a baby boy...I can picturise that someday when I come back from work after a...tiring day, he will take care of me," she added after watching a video on a reality show.

143.title: Starved myself of sex, food while filming for 'Silence': Andrew Garfield
143.article_body: Speaking about method acting, actor Andrew Garfield has said, "There [have] been a lot of misconceptions about what method acting is...it's not about being an a*****e to everyone on set." Recalling his experience while filming for Martin Scorsese's 'Silence', he said, "I had some pretty wild, trippy experiences from starving myself of sex and food at that time."

144.title: Disappointed with the way India played ODI series vs Zimbabwe: Maninder
144.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Maninder Singh said he is "disappointed" with the manner in which Team India played their recently concluded ODI series against Zimbabwe. "You should have taken some more challenge...This was an opportunity to test your opening batters in difficult conditions and then test your bowlers when the conditions become good for batting," added Maninder. India defeated Zimbabwe 3-0.

145.title: 4 friends returning from birthday party die in road accident in Gurugram
145.article_body: Four people were killed and another was injured after their car was hit from behind by a bus when the former was taking a u-turn near Khetawas village in Gurugram on Monday. The four deceased, Aavin, Abhishek, Jeshnaw and Paras, were friends and out of them two were students, police said. Notably, the deceased were returning from a birthday party.

146.title: Video shows man using chip implanted in his hand to unlock Tesla car in the US
146.article_body: A man from the US has shared a video of him using a small chip implanted in his hand to unlock his Tesla car. "The whole idea was that I would have...my car key in my right hand," Brandon Dalaly said. The chip can also be used to store data and cryptocurrencies and make credit card transactions in the future.

147.title: Don't have any problem doing 'Bigg Boss 16' with Rajeev Sen: Charu Asopa
147.article_body: Actress Charu Asopa has revealed that she has been approached by the makers of 'Bigg Boss' for the upcoming season, however, she added that she does not know if her husband Rajeev Sen has been contacted. This comes after the duo have filed for divorce. "I don't have any problem doing a show with him. Work is work," she added.

148.title: KCR was on tour with Kejriwal & Mann, can’t be coincidence: Amit Malviya
148.article_body: BJP leader Amit Malviya has linked Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao and TRS MLC K Kavitha with the Delhi excise policy case. "It can’t be mere coincidence...K Kavitha’s father KCR was recently on a tour with Arvind Kejriwal and Bhagwant Mann," Malviya tweeted. "Now her name figures in Kejriwal liquor scam for...facilitating bribe of ₹4.5 crore to Sisodia," he added.

149.title: BJP hates Prophet, Muslims: Owaisi on BJP MLA Raja Singh's remarks
149.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Tuesday condemned Telangana BJP MLA T Raja Singh's alleged derogatory remarks against Prophet Muhammad and said, "BJP hates Prophet Muhammad and Muslims. They want to destroy...social fabric of India." He added that the PM and BJP should react if they don't support the remarks. "Fight with us politically but not like this," he further said.

150.title: Man forges Thane Police Commissioner's signature to run security agency, held
150.article_body: A man, Shivam Lalsaheb Pandey, was arrested for allegedly forging Thane Police Commissioner Jai Jeet Singh's signature and making a fake permit to operate a security agency, an official said. A police team on Sunday raided Pandey's security agency premises. He showed a fake permit, which showed it was valid up to February 26, 2027, inspector SS Nimbalkar said.

151.title: MTDC to conduct guided tours in Pune, Mumbai during Ganesh Chaturthi
151.article_body: In a bid to popularise Ganesh Chaturthi among foreigners and non-Maharashtrians, the Maharashtra Tourism Development Corporation (MTDC) is planning to conduct guided tours in Pune and Mumbai this year. Tourists and devotees opting for the tours in Pune will be taken to locations including Kasba Ganpati, Kesari Wada and Tambdi Jogeshwari, an official said. The tours can be booked online.

152.title: Krunal Pandya ruled out of Royal London One-Day Cup due to groin injury
152.article_body: Indian all-rounder Krunal Pandya, who was playing for English county side Warwickshire, has been ruled out of the ongoing Royal London One-Day Cup after sustaining a groin injury. The 31-year-old picked up the injury while scoring 37 during Warwickshire's match against Nottinghamshire on August 17. Krunal played five Royal London Cup matches, scoring 134 runs at an average of 33.50.

153.title: Hyd flyover's inauguration postponed amid protests over Raja Singh's remarks
153.article_body: The inauguration of Hyderabad's Chandrayangutta flyover, which was scheduled to be held on Tuesday, has been postponed to August 27 amid protests in the city over BJP MLA Raja Singh's remarks against Prophet Muhammad. The extension of the flyover was scheduled to be inaugurated by AIMIM President Asaduddin Owaisi, Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao and AIMIM floor leader Akbaruddin Owaisi.

154.title: Will not accept any cabinet post if Liz Truss becomes PM: Sunak
154.article_body: British Prime Ministerial candidate Rishi Sunak has hinted he wouldn't accept any cabinet post offered by Liz Truss if she wins the election."[Cabinet ministers] really need to agree with the big things," he said, adding, "I wouldn't want to end up in a situation like that again." Sunak had resigned as Finance Minister over his differences with PM Boris Johnson.

155.title: Deceased govt employee's sister not entitled to job if wife is alive: HC
155.article_body: Allahabad High Court ruled that a deceased government employee's sister cannot be entitled to a job on compassionate grounds if his wife is still alive and has claimed for the appointment. HC was hearing a petition filed by a woman whose father was a 'safai karamchari'. After his death, the petitioner's brother was granted the appointment on compassionate grounds.

156.title: Cache of assault weapons recovered along India-Pakistan border in Punjab
156.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) recovered a cache of assault weapons along the India-Pakistan border in Punjab on Tuesday. Three AK series rifles with six magazines, two M3 submachine guns with four magazines and two pistols were unearthed in the state's Ferozepur sector in the early hours, officials said. The weapons are suspected to have been smuggled in from Pakistan.

157.title: Nawazuddin's first look from 'Haddi' out; social media users say 'unrecognisable'
157.article_body: Nawazuddin Siddiqui's first look from the film 'Haddi' was shared by Zee Studios on Instagram on Tuesday. Reacting to his post, social media users said he is "unrecognisable" in the motion poster and wrote, "Is that Nawaz?" and "Nawaz sir amazingly disguised." "Filming begins, releasing in 2023," Zee Studios wrote in the post.

158.title: SC criticises Baba Ramdev, says 'How can he accuse doctors as if they are killers?'
158.article_body: Supreme Court on Tuesday pulled up Baba Ramdev for ridiculing doctors and allopathy while praising Patanjali products. The CJI said, "How can he say all this...accusing all the doctors as if they are killers. He cannot abuse doctors and other systems of medicine." The court added, "What is the guarantee what he is advocating will cure people of all diseases?"

159.title: People said 'Oh man, kya kaam kiya hai', it gives me hope: Rohit on 'Mumbai..'
159.article_body: Actor Rohit Bose Roy, while talking about 'Mumbai Saga' said that people said, "Oh man, kya kaam kiya hai (What performance have you given)". "When 'Forensic' was released people said, 'We wanted to see more of Rohit in the film'. These kinds of things give me hope that at least the audience wants to see me," he added.

160.title: I delivered 'Gangubai...', so who's having last laugh: Alia on trolling
160.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has stated that the only way she can shut down trolls is through her movies. "I delivered a film like 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'. So who's having the last laugh? At least until I deliver my next flop," the actress added. She further said that feeling bad is a small price to pay for the work she does.

161.title: No 'Amrit Mahotsav' can be successful without Jawaharlal Nehru: Gehlot
161.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Monday said that PM Narendra Modi-led government does not want to tell the truth about history. "No 'Amrit Mahotsav' can be successful without Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru. There is no mention of Indira Gandhi in their regime," Gehlot added. "There were many great freedom fighters but they don't talk about them," he stated.

162.title: Leopard seen at DRDO facility in Pune; forest dept teams deployed
162.article_body: Teams from the forest department were deployed after a leopard was sighted inside the campus of a research and development facility of the Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) in Pune on Tuesday. A perimeter has been secured by security personnel, officials said. "Rescue operation for the leopard is currently on," Deputy Conservator of Forests (Pune division) Rahul Patil said.

163.title: China changes 'Minions: The Rise of Gru' ending, shows villain being jailed
163.article_body: Chinese censors changed the ending of animated film 'Minions: The Rise of Gru' for domestic release, as per viewers in the country. According to posts shared on Chinese microblogging site Weibo, an addendum shows main character Wild Knuckles being caught by police and serving 20 years in jail. The international version shows Wild Knuckles faking his death to evade capture.

164.title: RBL Bank shares rise 6% after Board approves ₹3,000 cr fundraise
164.article_body: RBL Bank shares rose more than 6% following its Board of Directors' approval to raise funds up to ₹3,000 crore through the issuance of debt securities on private placement. The bank's stock was trading at ₹104.25 at 2:05 pm, a 6.1% rise from the previous close. RBL Bank also sold 17.78% stake in Kilburn Engineering between May and August 2022.

165.title: Gold prices rise a day after hitting near one-month low
165.article_body: Gold prices rose on Tuesday in the international markets driven by a little pullback in the US dollar. It had hit its lowest since July 27 at $1,727.01 on Monday. Gold contracts were trading 0.2% higher on the Multi-Commodity Exchange (MCX) at ₹51,174 per 10 grams at 9:44 am. Spot gold had risen 0.2% at $1,738.90 per ounce.

166.title: Mumbai hotel gets threat call; caller says 4 bombs placed, asks for ₹5 cr
166.article_body: A man called The Lalit Hotel in Mumbai's Vile Parle East and said four bombs had been planted in hotel premises, police said. Police added that accused said he will give them locations and tell them how to diffuse bombs if they pay him ₹5 crore. The caller also said the family of the General Manager  was on their target.

167.title: SRK wanted to climb on top of the train's chimney: Farah on 'Chaiyya...'
167.article_body: Discussing the song 'Chaiyya Chaiyya' from 'Dil Se', choreographer Farah Khan said it was shot on top of a train, as they weren't permitted to shoot at Ooty railway station. "There was no...safety...I would say...I'd take extra dancers...in case some...fell off," added Farah. "SRK wanted to climb on...top of the train's chimney...We had to pull him down!" she stated.

168.title: 17-yr-old UP girl shouts for help in traffic jam, police save her from traffickers
168.article_body: A 17-year-old girl was saved from human traffickers after she raised an alarm on seeing police officers in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow. The girl was sitting in an SUV with human traffickers, who'd allegedly bought her from her uncle, and they were stuck in a traffic jam. A sub-inspector said that they surrounded the SUV after the girl cried for help.

169.title: Bangladesh to cut school, office hours to save power
169.article_body: Bangladesh will close schools for one more day each week and reduce office hours to ease an electricity shortage, Cabinet Secretary Khandker Anwarul Islam said. Last month, the South Asian country began daily two-hour power cuts. Bangladesh has shut down all 10 of its diesel power plants after Russia's invasion of Ukraine drove up the cost of imported fuel.

170.title: Spring in my step: Harshal Patel shares videos while recovering at NCA
170.article_body: India pacer Harshal Patel, who is undergoing rehabilitation for the rib injury he suffered last month, has shared videos of his training at the NCA. The 31-year-old, who can be seen sprinting in the videos, wrote, "Spring in my step." Harshal missed the white-ball series against West Indies and Zimbabwe and is also set to miss the upcoming Asia Cup.

171.title: UP govt to build Bankey Bihari temple corridor for devotees’ convenience: Minister
171.article_body: The UP government will build a dedicated corridor soon for the smooth movement of devotees from the Yamuna riverbank to Mathura’s Bankey Bihari temple, state minister Laxmi Narayan Chaudhary said. The corridor can accommodate over 50,000 devotees at a time. Devotees, after taking a dip in the Yamuna, can directly reach the temple via the corridor, the minister added.

172.title: Unknown man enters AIIMS ICU to click selfies with Raju Srivastava: Reports
172.article_body: An unidentified man entered the ICU in AIIMS Delhi to click selfies with comedian Raju Srivastava, according to reports. After the incident, guards have been deployed outside the ICU, the reports added. The comedian is undergoing treatment after suffering a heart attack on August 10 and is currently on ventilator support.

173.title: I've heard of Rajesh Khanna but I and the generation after don't care: Vijay
173.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda said that he is very happy to be "forgotten". "I have understood that nobody remembers," he said, adding, "I have known actors who are worshipped by the country...Rajesh Khanna, I have heard stories of him. But, me and the generation after are not aware of this or don't care. For them, now it is about somebody else."

174.title: Will consider making Mumbai-Pune Expressway 8 lanes, says Fadnavis
174.article_body: In response to a demand by NCP leader Ajit Pawar, Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Monday said, "We'll check the feasibility of making the Mumbai-Pune Expressway eight lanes."
