This comes after former MLC Vinayak Mete died in a car crash on the expressway. Fadnavis added that a request for the same will be put before state CM Eknath Shinde.

175.title: Pune's Ganesh mandal denied permission to depict Afzal Khan's killing
175.article_body: Pune's Kothrud Police denied permission to Sangam Mitra Mandal to depict Afzal Khan's killing during ten-day Ganesh Chaturthi festival starting August 31. "In the past, law and order issues...reported due to such tableaux," police said. A riot broke out in Sangli in 2009 over a poster on the killing of Khan, Kutub Shah of Bijapur's lieutenant, by Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj.

176.title: Ryan Reynolds posts about Indian eatery in UK, says 'Best Indian food in Europe'
176.article_body: Actor Ryan Reynolds posted a picture of a flyer of an Indian restaurant in UK's Cheshire on his Instagram story and wrote, "Best Indian Food in Europe." Reynolds, who has over 44 million followers on Instagram, has been spending time in the UK having taken over ownership of the National League football club Wrexham AFC.

177.title: Let me stay away from Twitter: Kapil on boycott 'Raksha Bandhan' trend
177.article_body: Reacting to the boycott trends on Twitter, actor-comedian Kapil Sharma said such trends keep coming. When asked about the boycott trend against Akshay Kumar’s film ‘Raksha Bandhan’, Kapil replied, “I’ve not heard of any such boycott against his films.” “Please let me stay away from the world of Twitter, it took a lot to come out of that,” he added.

178.title: BJP expels leader beaten by wife after getting caught with female friend
178.article_body: BJP leader Mohit Sonkar, who was publically beaten by his wife and in-laws with slippers after getting caught with a female friend in his car in Kanpur, has been expelled from the party. BJP's state general secretary Govind Narayan Shukla said that a letter in this regard has been sent to the party's state chief and other officials.

179.title: Former Apple car engineer, accused of stealing trade secrets, pleads guilty in US
179.article_body: Former Apple engineer Xiaolang Zhang pled guilty to stealing trade secrets while working on the company's car project between 2015 and 2018. Zhang faces up to 10 years in US prison and a $250,000 fine, as per CNBC. In 2018, Apple accused Zhang of downloading internal company files relating to its secretive car project, including circuit boards and a server.

180.title: Video shows soldiers beating up civilians in Srinagar, J&K Police file case
180.article_body: J&K Police registered a case on Monday after a video clip went viral purportedly showing soldiers beating up civilians in Srinagar, PTI reported. The Chinar Corps unit of the Army is ascertaining the authenticity of the video clip. "Prima facie it appears to be an old video, deliberately posted to tarnish the image of Armed Forces," an Army official said.

181.title: BBMP employee transfers ₹14 lakh public funds to friend, both arrested
181.article_body: Bengaluru Police have arrested a BBMP employee and his female friend after he allegedly transferred ₹14 lakh public money to her account. The incident came to light after a BBMP official filed complaint against Prakash for not submitting records of the annual audit. According to police, Prakash's friend Kanchana used the money to buy gold and live a luxurious life.

182.title: Why should I break it? I worked hard for it: Cezanne on being called Anurag
182.article_body: Actor Cezanne Khan, who portrayed Anurag Basu in 'Kasautii Zindagii Kay', has said that people keep telling him that he needs to break the tag. "But why? Maine mehnat kari hai uss character pe (I worked hard on that character)," he added. The actor further said that the part opened many doors for him and brought him love from audience.

183.title: B'luru's Mojocare raises $20 mn led by Facebook Co-founder's firm
183.article_body: Bengaluru-based health-tech startup Mojocare has raised $20.6 million in Series A funding round led by Facebook Co-founder Eduardo Saverin's VC firm B Capital Group. Others who participated in the round include Mojocare's existing investors Chiratae Ventures, Sequoia India's Surge, and Better Capital. Mojocare helps its consumers with issues including reproductive health and fertility.

184.title: Mexican journalist killed hours after posting about disappeared students
184.article_body: A Mexican journalist was shot dead on Monday in southern Mexico, authorities said. Fredid "Fredy" Roman was killed hours after posting a column on the alleged involvement of local politicians in the disappearance of 43 students in 2014, which investigators called a "state crime" last week. At least 18 other journalists have been killed in Mexico this year.

185.title: Sonali Phogat posted a video of herself hours before her death in Goa
185.article_body: In her last Instagram post, hours before her death, TikTok star and BJP leader Sonali Phogat had shared a video of herself sporting a pink turban. Phogat had passed away due to a heart attack in Goa on Monday night. She had gone to Goa with some of her employees, according to reports.

186.title: Sounds 'ridiculous' but we should've won: Klopp after loss vs Man Utd
186.article_body: Talking about Manchester United's 2-1 win against Liverpool, the latter's manager Jurgen Klopp said, "We should have won this game, I know it sounds ridiculous but that is how I saw it." "I am concerned about our situation...We are in a tricky situation injury wise," added Klopp. "Their second goal is hard to take, it was offside," he stated.

187.title: In a first, Tripura launches 24x7 national highway patrol service
187.article_body: Tripura CM Manik Saha on Monday launched the state's first-ever 24x7 national highway patrol vehicle service in a bid to reduce road accidents. "Drunk drivers will be identified as patrol vehicles will be equipped with speedometers, breath analysers, etc," he said. Moreover, he said that there's an 8% rise in road accidents and a 2.5% rise in fatalities every month.

188.title: Proud my 3 films collectively have 16 nominations at Filmfare: Parineeti
188.article_body: Actress Parineeti Chopra said she's "hugely proud" that her films 'Sandeep Aur Pinky Faraar', 'The Girl on the Train' and 'Saina' collectively have earned 16 nominations at the Filmfare Awards. Parineeti has also been nominated for Best Actress for 'Sandeep Aur Pinky Faraar'. "It's...validating for me to taste success in this period where everything is in flux," she stated.

189.title: 2 suspected terrorists killed during infiltration bid in J&K's Rajouri
189.article_body: Two suspected terrorists were killed during an infiltration attempt in the Naushera sector of Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri district on the intervening night of Monday-Tuesday, officials said. According to officials, while a group of suspected terrorists was trying to sneak into Pukharni village, one of them stepped over a landmine, which caused an explosion.

190.title: 15-yr-old tells Pune school counsellor she was raped 7 yrs ago; FIR filed
190.article_body: A 15-year-old student told a Pune school counsellor that she was raped by a boy seven years ago when she was in Class 3. Police filed an FIR after the counsellor, along with the victim and social activists, approached a police station. The boy, suspected to be 22 years old now, lived in her neighbourhood and had called her.

191.title: Latest ODI team rankings released after India's series win
191.article_body: The ICC has released the latest men's ODI team rankings after India completed a 3-0 series whitewash against Zimbabwe. With the series victory, third-placed India's rating points have jumped to 111. Meanwhile, Pakistan, who whitewashed Netherlands recently, are on the fourth position, with four rating points fewer than India. New Zealand lead the rankings with 124 rating points.

192.title: I started hating cricket as I couldn't see my dad before he died due to cricket: Stokes
192.article_body: England Test captain Ben Stokes said he started hating cricket as he couldn't see his father before he died due to his cricketing commitments. "The last time I saw dad was leaving New Zealand to go to IPL 2020...that was dictated by cricket," he said. He added, "I should have opened up about it sooner...I just thought 'cricket, cricket, cricket'."

193.title: Without Dilip Kumar saab, I can't have a happy birthday: Saira Banu
193.article_body: Veteran actress Saira Banu, who turned 78 on Tuesday, has said her relatives and friends are getting in touch with her to wish her on her birthday. "But without Dilip Kumar saab, I can't have a happy birthday. It just cannot be the same happiness and the same life that I used to live when he was around," she added.

194.title: We pooled in money and worked for free: Deverakonda on Arjun Reddy
194.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda said his first film 'Arjun Reddy' didn't have a producer, adding they "pooled in money" and "worked for free". "We didn't even find people to release it. It took us months because we were nobody...When 'Arjun Reddy' was to release, people gathered on the streets to...stop the release," added Deverakonda. "Every film was a struggle," he stated.

195.title: Future Retail receives loan claims worth ₹21,058 crore from 33 lenders
195.article_body: Future Retail (FRL) has received loan claims worth ₹21,058 crore from 33 lenders under the ongoing insolvency process. The development comes after the National Company Law Tribunal initiated insolvency proceedings against the debt-ridden company. Of the total claims made by creditors, about ₹17,511 crore has been verified by the interim resolution professional, the Kishore Biyani-led company said.

196.title: Debt-ridden man poisons wife, 2 kids; kills self at hotel in T'gana
196.article_body: A 37-year-old man poisoned his wife and two children and later died by suicide at a hotel in Telangana's Nizamabad district on Sunday, police said. According to officials, Suryaprakash had a real estate business in Madhapur and Kondapur, and was encountering losses. He had borrowed money from his business partners who had been pressuring him to repay it, police added.

197.title: Took 2 yrs to sign Tyson, talks broke down at one stage: Liger producer
197.article_body: 'Liger' producer Charmme Kaur said it took them two years to sign boxing legend Mike Tyson, adding that talks broke down at one point. "We sealed the deal...and then, COVID-19 happened...Tyson's team told me it's a deal-breaker...It was heartbreaking," added Charmme. Charmme stated that Tyson eventually agreed. "He would jump around in childlike glee, saying, 'I'm an actor!'" she said.

198.title: I request Rohit Sharma to make a statement, name the XI for Asia Cup: Kaif
198.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif has requested Team India captain Rohit Sharma to name the playing XI for the upcoming Asia Cup. "This is not about playing mind games...Rohit should make a statement, that this is our playing XI...Let's win this Asia Cup," stated Kaif. "Last year, Pakistan announced their XI a day earlier, but we waited for toss," he added.

199.title: BJP foisting 'false' cases against Oppn leaders ahead of 2024 LS polls: Akhilesh
199.article_body: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav on Monday said that the BJP is foisting "false" cases against Opposition leaders in the run-up to the 2024 Lok Sabha polls. "BJP foisting false cases…to divert people's attention from real issues such as price rise and unemployment," he added. "Action is being taken against them through government agencies…they are being sent to jail," Akhilesh stated.

200.title: E-comm firms speed up hiring of delivery agents for shopping season
200.article_body: E-commerce companies in India are accelerating the hiring of delivery personnel ahead of the annual shopping season that commences next month. Delivery workers and salespersons form a large chunk of the gig work employment. It is expected to reach 9.9 million in India in 2022-23, a rise of about 45% from 2019-20, according to a NITI Aayog report in June.

201.title: Police pose as food delivery men to catch bike-borne snatchers in Mumbai
201.article_body: A team of policemen posed as food delivery executives and camped outside Mumbai's Vithalwadi railway station for three days to catch two chain snatchers. The investigation began after a businessman complained that his gold chain was snatched by two bike-borne men near Borivali National Park. Police scanned over 200 CCTV cameras to arrest the duo accused in four such cases.

202.title: Arrest warrant against dancer Sapna Choudhary for not performing at an event
202.article_body: An arrest warrant has been issued against Haryanvi dancer and singer Sapna Choudhary. Sapna had not performed at an event in 2018 for which she was paid by organisers in advance, following which the organisers filed a court case, according to ANI. She will reportedly be produced in a court in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow soon.

203.title: Domestic help sentenced to 30 yrs for sexually assaulting employers' son in C'garh
203.article_body: A 25-year-old man employed as domestic help by a doctor couple in Chandigarh has been sentenced to 30 years of rigorous imprisonment for sexually assaulting their 8-year-old son. The incident came to light when the victim's mother came home early and caught him in the act. The Chandigarh district court also imposed a fine of ₹1 lakh on the convict.

204.title: Car barges into Jammu railway station; minor girl dead, 6 injured
204.article_body: A speeding car barged into Jammu railway station's premises and fatally hit a seven-year-old girl and left six others injured on Monday, officials said. According to eyewitnesses, the car entered from the wrong side, hit multiple people, rammed into an autorickshaw and then stopped. The wife of an injured person claimed that the administration and police aren't helping her.

205.title: Trump seeks to block FBI from reviewing items seized from Florida home
205.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump has asked a federal court to stop the FBI from reviewing the documents it seized from his Florida home earlier this month until a special master can be appointed to oversee the process. In a lawsuit, Trump has also demanded a receipt of all the items the FBI seized at Mar-a-Lago on August 8.

206.title: Chandigarh sets 25 kmph speed limit around schools, hospitals
206.article_body: Chandigarh administration has fixed a maximum speed limit of 25 kmph for all vehicles around schools, educational institutions and hospitals. "We've shared the cautionary signages to be installed around schools," SSP (Traffic and Security) Manisha Choudhary said. "We had recommended the speed limit...as per the Motor Vehicle Act in the last Road Safety Council meeting on July 27," Choudhary added.

207.title: BJP T'gana chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar detained amid protest against arrest of party workers
207.article_body: Telangana Police has detained BJP state chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar in Jangaon. "Kumar was holding a protest against party workers' arrest in Hyderabad," BJP's NV Subhash said. "Strongly condemn police registering a case of attempted murder against BJP leaders who were protesting at CM KCR's daughter K Kavitha's house demanding an answer to allegations in Delhi's liquor scam," Kumar tweeted.

208.title: Noida Supertech twin towers fitted with 3,700-kg explosives, to take 10 seconds to blast
208.article_body: The illegal Supertech twin towers in Noida have been rigged with around 3,700 kg of explosives ahead of its demolition on Sunday, officials said. "It'll take 9-10 seconds for all the explosives to blast in a series making a loud noise. After the blasts, the structures...would take four to five seconds to come down completely," an Edifice Engineering partner said.

209.title: Why did you select Rahul Tripathi at all: Aakash Chopra on Zimbabwe ODIs
209.article_body: Commentator Aakash Chopra has asked why Rahul Tripathi was selected in the squad for the Zimbabwe ODIs when he was not going to be given a chance to play in the series. "You're not even able to play him in a dead rubber," added Aakash. India played the third and final ODI with an unassailable 2-0 lead.

210.title: Usain Bolt files for trademark to protect his famous victory pose in US
210.article_body: Athletics icon Usain Bolt has filed an application with the US Patent and Trademark Office to trademark a logo of his signature victory celebration pose. The widely recognised pose features Bolt leaning back and gesturing to the sky. According to the trademark application, Bolt plans to use the logo on items including clothing, jewellery, restaurants and sports bars.

211.title: Bilkis Bano case convicts' release challenged in SC, CJI to consider listing it
211.article_body: The release of 11 convicts in the Bilkis Bano gangrape case has been challenged in the Supreme Court. Reports said that Chief Justice NV Ramana has said he would consider listing the matter.  Bilkis Bano had issued a statement after their release, saying that the release has taken her peace and shaken her faith in justice.

212.title: Elon Musk criticised over claims he took a 9-minute trip on his private jet
212.article_body: Elon Musk is being criticised after a Twitter user claimed that the world's richest person took a 9-minute flight from San Jose to San Francisco on his private jet. The user wrote that the same distance on an express train would have been five stops or nearly an hour. Meanwhile, a journalist suggested that the jet was likely being repositioned.

213.title: Class 4 girl collapses near stairs at pvt school in Gurugram, dies
213.article_body: A class four student died after she allegedly fell unconscious at a private school in Gurugram on Monday, police said. A police officer said that the family of the girl, who had felt dizzy and collapsed near the stairs, "hasn't filed any complaint or alleged foul play". The girl's grandfather said that the deceased "didn't suffer from any health ailment."

214.title: Man pushes wife in front of moving train, runs away with 2 children in Maha; video surfaces
214.article_body: A man killed his wife by pushing her in front of a moving train at Vasai Road railway station in Maharashtra on Monday. The CCTV footage showed the man waking his wife up, dragging her to the edge of the platform and pushing her in front of the train. The man later picked up his two children and ran away.

215.title: Would be dream come true if I get cast in mythological film: Sharvari
215.article_body: Actress Sharvari Wagh has said that it would be "an absolute dream come true" for her if she gets cast in a mythological film. "My father used to narrate the Mahabharata to me every night when I was a child and I used to be fascinated with the tale," she added. She revealed she "voraciously" read mythologies growing up.

216.title: Gehlot can't see anything beyond devotion to Gandhi family: Shekhawat
216.article_body: Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat said Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot can't see anything beyond devotion to Gandhi family. His remarks came after Gehlot criticised BJP for forgetting leaders like ex-PM Jawaharlal Nehru and Indira Gandhi. "Gehlot...didn't understand the definition of 'Amrit Mahotsav' of Independence under which...BJP honoured those who were unknown in the country," Shekhawat said.

217.title: US Labor Dept accuses Hyundai supplier of violating child labour laws
217.article_body: SL Alabama, the Korean-owned auto parts maker and supplier of Hyundai Motor, was accused by the US Department of Labor of violating child labour laws by employing underage workers at an Alabama factory. Admitting to the allegation, SL said an external labour recruitment firm had hired the minors. Hyundai said, "It doesn't tolerate illegal employment practices in any Hyundai entity."

218.title: Australian boy with dwarfism, who was bullied, lands role in 'Mad Max' movie
218.article_body: Quaden Bayles, an indigenous Australian boy who won the support of celebrities after being bullied because of his disability, has landed a role in forthcoming movie 'Mad Max: Furiosa'. Oscar-winning director George Miller said he was moved to put the 11-year-old on the big screen after watching the video his mother shared of him in 2020.

219.title: They didn't talk about the film's story even once: Vivek on 'Laal...'
219.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' director Vivek Agnihotri said there's nobody who can tell what 'Laal Singh Chaddha' is about, if they haven't seen the film, as the story wasn't discussed by the makers. Talking about 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' and 'Shamshera', Vivek stated, "'Jayeshbhai'...was about female infanticide. But...Ranveer...danced with girls...[during promotions]...Same thing happened with...Shamshera."

220.title: Over a dozen aspiring teachers injured in police lathicharge in Patna
220.article_body: Over a dozen job aspirants protesting over pending appointments of teachers were injured in a lathicharge by police in Patna on Monday. Some of the protesters allegedly pelted stones at police, who then used water cannons and resorted to lathicharge. Patna ADM KK Singh was seen beating a protester, following which DM Chandrashekhar Singh ordered a probe against him.

221.title: Swapna Patkar, a witness in the Patra Chawl scam, summoned by ED
221.article_body: Swapna Patkar, a key witness in the Patra Chawl scam case, has been summoned by the Enforcement Directorate for questioning today. Patkar, who lodged several complaints since 2013 against unknown people for stalking and harassment, had alleged that MP Sanjay Raut was behind it. The judicial custody of Raut has been extended till September 5 in connection with the case.

222.title: Rahul should accept Cong President’s post, understand workers’ sentiments: Raj CM
222.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Monday said that if Rahul Gandhi does not become Congress President, it will be a disappointment for Congress workers across the country. "He should understand the sentiments of Congress workers and accept this post," Gehlot added. He stated that the party is "unanimously" in favour of Rahul Gandhi becoming the next Congress President.

223.title: 16-yr-old strangles 13-yr-old Dalit in Ghaziabad to 'get out of studying'
223.article_body: A 16-year-old boy has been arrested in Ghaziabad for strangling a 13-year-old Dalit boy to death on Monday. The accused revealed during interrogation that he had decided to commit a crime as a way to "get out of studying", police said. The boys were neighbours and had gone out to play. The victim's body was discovered on the Delhi-Meerut expressway.

224.title: Apple to start making iPhone 14 in India 2 months after China production: Report
224.article_body: Apple will start manufacturing iPhone 14 in India two months after the Chinese-made ones are released, Bloomberg reported. Apple is reportedly aiming to shorten the gap in the production of new iPhone in India from six to nine months for previous launches. The first iPhone 14s from India are likely to be finished by October or November, the report added.

225.title: Twitter users react as Man Utd beat Liverpool in PL for 1st time since 2018
225.article_body: Manchester United defeated Liverpool 2-1 in a Premier League match to record their first win against the latter since 2018. "United showing 17 other clubs exactly how to play against Liverpool," read a tweet from a fan. "Imagine the embarrassment of being a Liverpool fan and your season's so bad, you can't even beat Man United!" read another reaction.

226.title: The way Raza was batting, we felt he could snatch the game away: Axar Patel
226.article_body: Team India all-rounder Axar Patel has said the way Zimbabwe all-rounder Sikandar Raza batted while chasing India's 290-run target in the third ODI, they felt he could "snatch the game away". "But we backed our plans and did not relax till the last ball," added Axar. Raza got out after scoring 115 and Zimbabwe lost the game by 13 runs.

227.title: SP leader arrested in UP for rally against release of Bilkis' rapists
227.article_body: SP leader Shane Alam was arrested on Monday in UP's Moradabad for holding a rally against the release of convicts in the Bilkis Bano gangrape case. He raised slogans against Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the country, said police. He and three others have been booked for rioting and promoting enmity between groups.

228.title: 7 injured as fire breaks out at pharma unit on Hyderabad outskirts
228.article_body: Seven workers of a pharmaceutical factory were injured when a major fire broke out on the firm premises at Jeedimetla Industrial Estate on the outskirts of Hyderabad on Monday. Locals reported hearing a loud explosion following which fire and smoke engulfed the facility. "All...injured workers are being treated at...local hospitals at Shapur Nagar," Jeedimetla Police Inspector M Sridhar said.

229.title: Video shows delivery boy carrying daughter & son to deliver food; Zomato responds
229.article_body: Food blogger Saurabh Panjwani shared a video showing a Zomato delivery agent carrying his small daughter and son while delivering food. "This Zomato delivery partner spends the whole day in the sun with two children," he wrote. "Please share the order details in a private message so that we can reach out and help out the delivery partner," Zomato commented.

230.title: Want to change UK-India relationship, make it more two-way: Sunak
230.article_body: UK PM candidate Rishi Sunak said he wants to change the UK-India relationship to make it a more "two-way relationship" that opens up easy access to British students and companies in India. Sunak made these comments during a campaign event hosted by Conservative Friends of India diaspora organisation in London. The new UK PM will be announced on September 5.

231.title: Man shot dead by 2 bike-borne persons while on way to work in Pune
231.article_body: A 27-year-old man was shot dead by two bike-borne persons near a temple in Pune's Chandan Nagar area while he was on his way to work. "Efforts are on to nab...accused and teams are checking CCTV footage of the area for clues," police officials said. The police suspect that the incident took place over a fall-out of past rivalry.

232.title: 4 of family, on way to celebrate 2-yr-old's b'day, killed in accident in Raj
232.article_body: Four family members, including two children aged two and eight years, were killed in a road accident in Rajasthan's Sikar district on Monday. The incident occurred when their car collided with a truck coming from opposite direction, police said. Notably, the family was on its way to celebrate the birthday of the two-year-old girl who also died in the incident.

233.title: If you don't like me, don't watch me: Alia Bhatt on nepotism criticism
233.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt, speaking about dealing with nepotism debate and trolls, has said, "I can't keep defending myself verbally...if you don't like me, don't watch me. I can't help it." She added that she could end the conversation through her movies. "I shut up, went home and did my work. I delivered a film like 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'," she stated.

234.title: Brain-chip startup Neuralink to give progress update on Oct 31: Musk
234.article_body: Elon Musk has announced that his brain-chip startup Neuralink will provide a progress update in a 'show and tell' event on Halloween, October 31. In its last big update, Neuralink had demonstrated a monkey with a chip implanted in its brain playing a video game. The announcement comes amid reports that Neuralink has offered to invest in its rival Synchron.

235.title: Revenue Secy Tarun Bajaj gets additional charge of Corporate Affairs Secretary
235.article_body: Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj has been given additional charge of Secretary in the Ministry of Corporate Affairs. This comes after former Secretary Rajesh Verma was made Secretary to President Droupadi Murmu last week. The Ministry of Personnel, Public Grievances and Pensions said that Bajaj will continue with the additional charge till a regular Secretary is appointed or until further orders.

236.title: TikTok star and BJP leader Sonali Phogat dies of heart attack in Goa
236.article_body: TikTok star and BJP leader Sonali Phogat died last night of a heart attack in Goa. Phogat had lost from the Adampur seat in the 2019 Haryana Assembly elections to Congress leader Kuldeep Bishnoi, who recently switched over from the Congress party to the BJP. Phogat had said she won't quit TikTok or acting if she becomes an MLA.

237.title: Worked on Vijay's body for 2+ yrs, used to workout at his home: Coach on Liger
237.article_body: Fitness coach Kuldep Sethi said he worked with actor Vijay Deverakonda for 'Liger' for over two years due to COVID-19 lockdown. "Otherwise...it would have taken...around six months to achieve and maintain his physique," he said. "We had to keep working out through lockdown...[or] he would have...lost the look we had achieved. We used to workout at his home," he added.

238.title: Argentine prosecutor seeks 12-year jail term for Vice President
238.article_body: An Argentine federal prosecutor has asked a judge to sentence Cristina Fernández, Argentina's ex-President and current Vice President, to 12 years in prison and bar her from holding public office ever again. Fernández has been on trial since 2019 for allegedly defrauding the state and involvement in a scheme to divert public funds while being President between 2007 and 2015.

239.title: Who is Anna Mani, the Weather Woman of India, celebrated by Google today?
239.article_body: Google is celebrating physicist and meteorologist Anna Mani's 104th birth anniversary with a special doodle. Anna Mani, known as 'the Weather Woman of India', was born in 1918 in Kerala and was one of India's first female scientists, who later served as the Deputy Director General of the IMD. She played a major role in the field of meteorological instrumentation.

240.title: Missing J&K woman found dead in Punjab; protesters block highway
240.article_body: After a woman from Jammu and Kashmir's Samba was found dead near railway tracks in Punjab's Ludhiana, hundreds of protesters on Monday blocked Jammu-Pathankot National Highway by placing her body on the road and demanded a CBI probe. The deceased's father alleged that there was "foul play" involved. The protesters dispersed peacefully after police and civil administration officials pacified them.

241.title: T'gana BJP MLA Raja Singh arrested over remarks against Prophet after massive protests
241.article_body: Telangana BJP MLA T Raja Singh has been arrested over alleged derogatory remarks against Prophet Muhammad following massive protests in Hyderabad. This comes after Singh released a 'comedy' video against comedian Munawar Faruqui who held a show in Hyderabad last week. Protesters blocked the road outside the city police commissioner's office and entered the office of DCP (south zone).

242.title: Finnish PM Sanna Marin tests negative in drug test taken after her viral party video
242.article_body: Finnish PM Sanna Marin has tested negative in a drug test that she took after a video showing her partying went viral on social media. Marin previously said she was "spending an evening with friends" and that the video was "filmed in private premises". "Never in my life...have I ever used any drugs," she had said.

243.title: Bollywood is discredited by people who don't like us: Swara Bhasker
243.article_body: Speaking about cancel culture, actress Swara Bhasker stated that Bollywood is discredited by people who don't like certain individuals. The actress added that films like Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha', Taapsee Pannu's 'Dobaaraa' and Akshay Kumar's 'Raksha Bandhan' have suffered due to boycott trends on Twitter. She further said Bollywood is not responsible for audience not coming to theatres.

244.title: Man makes friend's Facebook ID, threatens to blow up Gorakhnath temple; held
244.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police have arrested a man for threatening to blow up Gorakhnath temple. He had shared a post after making Facebook ID in his friend's name. "Mubarak Ali [accused] had borrowed ₹40,000 from Basalat Ali...When Basalat Ali asked him to return money...Mubarak Ali took a SIM in [his] name...[and] posted threat message to implicate him in...police case," police said.

245.title: Dravid tests positive for COVID-19, unlikely to travel with team for Asia Cup: Reports
245.article_body: Team India head coach Rahul Dravid has tested positive for COVID-19 just days ahead of the Asia Cup 2022, as per reports. He is unlikely to travel with the team to UAE for the tournament that will start on August 27, reports added. India will open their Asia Cup 2022 campaign against Pakistan on August 28.

246.title: Goods train derails near Bhubaneswar station; rly traffic affected
246.article_body: Five wagons of a goods train derailed near Odisha's Bhubaneswar Railway Station on Monday due to which railway traffic was affected on Bhubaneswar-Kolkata route, DRM Khurda Road Rinkesh Roy said. The incident occurred around 8.30 pm. Many trains were affected and passengers were sleeping at the station as they were unable to return to their houses or hotels, he added.

247.title: Everyone kept calling Rahul 'pappu' so now all believe it, but he's intelligent: Swara
247.article_body: Speaking about Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, actress Swara Bhasker said, "Everyone kept calling him pappu, so now everybody believes it. I have met him and he is a perfectly intelligent and articulate man." She said this while comparing Rahul's situation with the hate against Bollywood and added, "With Bollywood also, this 'pappufication' has happened."

248.title: I hope so too: Rashmika to fan saying her Pushpa 2 role should be more impactful
248.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna responded to a fan on social media who requested for her character Srivalli to be stronger and more impactful in 'Pushpa: The Rule'. The actress tweeted, "I hope so too let's see." Rashmika portrays the love interest of Allu Arjun's character in the first film 'Pushpa: The Rise'. The sequel went on floors on Monday.

249.title: Nizam sitting at Centre scared of Arvind Kejriwal: Manish Sisodia
249.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Monday said that the "Nizam sitting in the Centre is scared of CM Arvind Kejriwal". "So, in order to arrest his Education Minister, you raid his residence and search his cupboards, ration, mattresses, pillows and blankets to see if there is any hidden gold or money," Sisodia added. "I am honest," he stated.

250.title: Crude oil price rises after Saudi warns OPEC+ could cut production
250.article_body: Crude oil prices rose on Tuesday after Saudi Arabia warned that OPEC+ could cut production to stabilise the market after a drop in oil futures. West Texas Intermediate for October delivery rose 0.4% to $90.72/barrel on the New York Mercantile Exchange at 8:05 am in Singapore. Brent for October settlement rose 0.3% to $96.81/barrel on the ICE Futures Europe exchange.

251.title: My unconventional choices have stood out, become my brand identity: Bhumi
251.article_body: Actress Bhumi Pednekar has said that her unconventional choices in projects have stood out and have become her brand identity. "Today, I'm assuming that people naturally feel...if I'm a part of a project, it will be different, disruptive and high on content," she added. Bhumi further added, "They know...I'll do my best to deliver a performance that they will love."

252.title: Raza gave a good fight, but India held their nerves: Zimbabwe captain on 13-run defeat
252.article_body: Zimbabwe captain Regis Chakabva has praised all-rounder Sikandar Raza for his 115-run innings against India in the third and final ODI. "Raza...gave a good fight, but India held their nerve...The boys fought hard in the field [also]. We came back strongly from a tough situation. Raza was outstanding," stated Chakabva. Chasing India's 290-run target, Zimbabwe got bundled out for 276.

253.title: Centre suspends ex-excise commissioner, deputy in Delhi liquor 'scam'
253.article_body: Ministry of Home Affairs suspended former Delhi excise commissioner Arava Gopi Krishna and former deputy excise commissioner Anand Kumar Tiwari in connection with the alleged Delhi liquor scam, officials said. Krishna and Tiwari were named by CBI in FIR in the ongoing probe. Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia is also named in FIR in connection with the alleged scam.

254.title: Have seen people lose their lives after their films leaked: Arun Vijay
254.article_body: Actor Arun Vijay, who featured in the show 'Tamil Rockerz' which is based on film piracy, has said, "It's high time people realise and stop watching pirated content." He further added, "Everyone gets affected, not just financially. We have seen people losing their lives." Arun said that people will see the efforts of the film industry after watching 'Tamil Rockerz'.

255.title: I'm detached from comparisons, else I'll lose focus: Vaani Kapoor
255.article_body: Actress Vaani Kapoor stated that she is detached from being compared to or pitted against other actors, adding that it's okay since they are public figures. "If I keep fretting over what others are doing, I will lose my focus and my dedication," she said. The actress added that one needs to be a horse with blinders in the industry.

256.title: I still feel very young, got my dad's genes: Sonam on being mother at 37
256.article_body: Speaking about becoming a mother at the age of 37, actress Sonam Kapoor stated that she still feels "very young", adding that she has her father Anil Kapoor's genes. The actress said, "Everyone's so tense about women who get pregnant after 31 or 32. They tell you...don't get gestational diabetes or pre-eclampsia. I was like...'It'll be fine'."

257.title: Each joint like a speed breaker: B'luru police ex-chief on Shivananda flyover
257.article_body: Bengaluru's former Police Commissioner and current AAP leader Bhaskar Rao criticised the quality of construction of the Shivananda Circle steel flyover. "I travelled on Shivananda Circle flyover, each joint seemed like a speed breaker," Rao tweeted. "We can grin and bear it as none will be held accountable," he added. The newly-opened flyover has been closed citing repair work.

258.title: Corrupt water meter readers & firms to face FIRs in Delhi: Saurabh Bharadwaj
258.article_body: Delhi Jal Board vice-chairman Saurabh Bharadwaj on Monday asked officials to file police complaints against water meter readers and private companies indulging in corrupt practices. “Water is a basic right of everyone irrespective of one’s status in life...There are reports where private meter readers have been demanding money to manipulate meter readings,” said Bharadwaj.

259.title: Targeting of judges in public domain must be contained: Vice Prez Dhankhar
259.article_body: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar on Monday said that targeting judges in the public domain needs to be contained. "Recent unfortunate emergence of a pernicious trend to target individual judges in the public domain calls for exemplary containment," Dhankhar added. "Dignity of judges is key and among the fundamental parts of the rule of law and constitutionalism," he stated.

260.title: Mumbai's 150-yr-old Carnac Bridge shut, to open again after reconstruction
260.article_body: Mumbai's Carnac Bridge, which is reportedly over 150 years old was shut down for vehicular and pedestrian traffic on August 22. It will re-open after reconstruction. Traffic from P D'Mello Road towards Chakala Junction will be diverted to Avtar Singh Bedi Chowk. Vehicles can also move through Wadi Bunder Junction and proceed to Chakala Junction via SVP Road, reports said.

261.title: India reports 8,586 new COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, positivity rate drops to 2.19%
261.article_body: India has reported 8,586 new COVID-19 cases and 48 deaths in the last 24 hours including six reconciled deaths in Kerala, according to the Health Ministry. Active cases in the country went down to 96,506, while the daily positivity rate declined to 2.19%. India also reported 9,680 recoveries in the last 24 hours, taking the total recoveries to 4,37,33,624.

262.title: World number one Carlsen praises 17-year-old Praggnanandhaa, jokes about his own age
262.article_body: World number one chess player Magnus Carlsen praised 17-year-old Indian Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa for his performance at FTX Crypto Cup. "Fully deserved...after performance that showed great resilience, determination, and quality," he wrote for Praggnanandhaa, who came second. "As for me, I'm happy to (barely) be younger than the second & third place finishers combined," the 31-year-old wrote.

263.title: Nandan Nilekani-backed startup ShopX shuts down, files for bankruptcy
263.article_body: E-commerce platform ShopX, backed by Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani, has confirmed that it has shut down operations. The startup has filed an application under Section 10 of the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code, 2016. ShopX decided to shut down business after "it became unviable to operate at scale given the low margin profile", a spokesperson for the company told Financial Express.

264.title: Will respect Brazil election result if clean, transparent: Bolsonaro
264.article_body: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro said he'd respect the result of an October election if the voting is "clean and transparent". Bolsonaro, in an interview with TV Globo's Jornal Nacional, also insisted, without evidence, that there had been fraud in past Brazilian elections. Opinion polls show Bolsonaro trailing in the Presidential race to leftist rival, ex-President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva.

265.title: We should learn to spell his name correctly: Mahindra as Praggnanandhaa defeats Carlsen
265.article_body: After India's 17-year-old Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa defeated world number one Magnus Carlsen at FTX Crypto Cup, businessman Anand Mahindra tweeted, "We should all learn how to spell his name correctly!" "Take a good look at that young, but intense face. If Chess is a Game of Thrones then there may be a new occupier of the throne soon," Mahindra added.

266.title: Masked assailants open fire in Delhi's JJ Colony; 2 killed, 1 injured
266.article_body: At least two persons were killed and one was seriously injured after masked assailants opened fire in Delhi's JJ Colony area. "The neighbours informed me...two people came...fired at my brother and two other older men who were sitting with him," the brother of one of the deceased said. "Police told us two people were killed, including my brother," he added.

267.title: Brazil's 1st emperor's heart arrives from Portugal to mark 200 yrs of independence
267.article_body: The embalmed heart of Brazil's first emperor, Dom Pedro I, has arrived in the capital Brasilia to mark 200 years of independence from Portugal. The heart, which has been kept in an urn with formaldehyde since Pedro's death in 1834, was flown on board a military plane from Portugal. The heart will be returned to Portugal after Brazil's independence day.

268.title: Which 5 teams are yet to win a match in PL 2022-23 as Gameweek 3 concludes?
268.article_body: Liverpool, who lost to Manchester United on Monday night, have failed to win any of their opening three games of the season and are placed 16th on the Premier League table. Liverpool are followed by Everton with two defeats and one draw. Wolves, Leicester City and West Ham are also yet to register a victory in the season so far.

269.title: Sensex falls 361 points to open at 58,412, Nifty down 114 points
269.article_body: The benchmark indices opened in the red on Tuesday with Sensex falling 361.86 points to 58,412.01. Nifty was down 114.70 points at 17,376. Wipro, Infosys, Tech Mahindra, HCL Technologies and Tata Motors were among the major Nifty losers, while NTPC, Power Grid Corp and Mahindra & Mahindra stocks gained. Nearly 727 shares advanced and 1,176 shares declined.

270.title: Next Nobel Prize for himself: BJP leader after Kejriwal's 'Bharat Ratna' remark
270.article_body: Soon after Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said his deputy Manish Sisodia deserves "Bharat Ratna", BJP’s BL Santhosh tweeted, "Padma Vibhushan for Satyendar Jain…Bharat Ratna for Manish Sisodia…Next Nobel Prize for himself…Great going anarchist party AAP." Santhosh tweeted without mentioning Kejriwal's name. "Such a person should get Bharat Ratna...they conducted CBI raid against him," Kejriwal had said.

271.title: B'luru's Shivananda bridge closed after commuters complain of uneven surface
271.article_body: Bengaluru's Shivananda Circle flyover, which was opened to the public last week, has been closed by the civic authorities. Reportedly, this comes after passengers complained about the uneven and steep gradient of the bridge and called the travel experience "back-breaking". The bridge is expected to reduce travel time to reach the Seshadripuram railway underpass from the Race Course Road.

272.title: Family to get ₹1 crore if defence personnel dies in service: Gujarat government
272.article_body: The Gujarat government has announced ₹1 crore compensation for the families of defence or paramilitary personnel who die "under any circumstances" while in service. The monthly assistance of ₹1,000 for widows of slain defence/ paramilitary personnel has also been revised to ₹5,000. Parents of unmarried soldiers are now entitled to ₹5 lakh compensation and ₹5,000 each per month for both.

273.title: Actor Arjun Bijlani replaces Rannvijay Singha as Splitsvilla 14 host
273.article_body: Actor Arjun Bijlani will be replacing Rannvijay Singha as the host of 'Splitsvilla X4' and will be hosting the show with actress Sunny Leone. "The show has always been such a massive hit with the youth...I'm super excited to take up this mantle," Arjun said in a statement. "I'm looking forward to Arjun as my co-host," Sunny stated.

274.title: Nitish not even 'CM material', how could he be 'PM material'?: Union Minister
274.article_body: Union Minister Giriraj Singh said Bihar CM Nitish Kumar is not even "CM material" as he couldn't form a government on his own even once. "We formed an alliance with him and made him CM. But like 2010, he was once again bitten by PM material bug…He's not even CM material, how can he become PM material?" Singh asked.

275.title: Tree falls in college premises in Pune; gardener killed, 3 injured
275.article_body: A 49-year-old gardener was killed and three others were injured after a 30-foot-tall tree fell on the premises of Pune's SP College on Monday, fire brigade officials said. The college had sent letters to PMC about the old tree that could fall anytime, a contractual worker of the college stated. An accidental death case has been filed, a sub-inspector said.

276.title: Wall Street closes lower amid fears over Fed's stance at Wyoming
276.article_body: Wall Street closed lower on Monday as investors worried about the US Federal Reserve's stance on interest rates at the Wyoming gathering later this week. The S&P 500 dropped by 2.1% and the Dow Jones Industrial Average fell by 1.9%. The Nasdaq declined by 2.5%. Among the losers were Nvidia Corporation, which dropped by 4.6%, and Amazon.com falling 3.6%.

277.title: Day after sharp dip, COVID-19 cases cross 900-mark in Bengaluru
277.article_body: A day after Bengaluru recorded a sharp dip in COVID-19 cases with just 273 new patients, the number climbed back to cross the 900-mark on Monday. The city saw 931 new cases in a day, taking the cumulative total to 18,58,948, BBMP Chief Commissioner tweeted. No new deaths were recorded, while the positivity rate stood at 6.12%.

278.title: Hyd police book BJP MLA Raja Singh for remarks on Prophet Muhammad
278.article_body: The Hyderabad police on Tuesday morning registered an FIR against Goshamahal BJP legislator T Raja Singh for his alleged remarks against Prophet Muhammad. Singh had reportedly released a video late last night wherein he made derogatory comments about Prophet Muhammad and called it "comedy". Multiple complaints were filed against him at various police stations in Hyderabad's south zone.

279.title: Delhi hospital staffer demands ₹25,000 bribe to get man admitted, held
279.article_body: Delhi's Anti-Corruption Branch (ACB) has arrested a 48-year-old nursing orderly of GB Pant Hospital for allegedly demanding a ₹25,000 bribe to get an injured man admitted to another hospital, officials said. The complainant, who was the injured man's employer, had initially paid ₹10,000 to the accused but later approached ACB when accused apparently threatened him to pay the remaining amount.

280.title: Vile, cruel crime: Russian Prez Putin on murder of ally's daughter
280.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Monday called the killing of Darya Dugina, daughter of his close ally Alexander Dugin, in a car bomb attack near Moscow on Saturday "a vile, cruel crime". He also posthumously awarded Dugina the Order of Courage, praising her "dedication shown in the performance of professional duty". Russia has accused Ukrainian special services of killing Dugina.

281.title: Is his ideology that of terrorists?: Vivek after Kashyap's remark on 'The...'
281.article_body: Reacting to filmmaker Anurag Kashyap saying he hasn't seen 'The Kashmir Files' as it's "not his ideology", the film's director Vivek Agnihotri tweeted, "Does this mean his ideology is that of Islamic Terrorists Brotherhood?" "This genius filmmaker says the film which is about Hindu genocide isn't his ideology," added Vivek. "Look at the intellectual dishonesty of these people," he stated.

282.title: Imams from other states will have to inform police, register on govt portal: Assam CM
282.article_body: All imams (clerics) from outside Assam will have to report to the local police station for verification of identity, CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said. An online government portal will be made on which imams and madrasa teachers will have to register themselves, Sarma added. This comes after two Assam imams were arrested over alleged links with Al-Qaeda-affiliated terror outfits.

283.title: Sania pulls out of US Open due to injury, says 'It'll change some of my retirement plans'
283.article_body: Indian tennis player Sania Mirza has pulled out of US Open 2022 due to injury. Taking to Instagram, she wrote, "I'll be out for a [few] weeks...This isn't ideal and it's terrible timing and it will change some of my retirement plans." Earlier this year, Sania had said that she wouldn't be playing beyond the 2022 season.

284.title: Businessman forces wife to bathe naked in public in 'ritual to conceive boy' in Maha
284.article_body: A 38-year-old businessman allegedly forced his wife to bathe naked in public under a waterfall in Maharashtra's Ratnagiri as part of a black magic ritual initiated by a self-styled godman. He allegedly told the couple it'd help them conceive a male child. Police arrested four people including the man, his father, mother and the self-styled godman after the woman's complaint.

285.title: Fan asks Afridi his views on Kohli not scoring a century in 1,000+ days, he replies
285.article_body: During a question-answer session on Twitter, a fan asked former Pakistan captain and all-rounder Shahid Afridi about his take on Virat Kohli not scoring an international century for over 1,000 days. Afridi replied, "Bare players ka mushkil waqt me hi pata chalta hai (the true spirit of big players is seen when they are facing difficult times.)"

286.title: Team India players dance on 'Kala Chashma' in dressing room to celebrate win, video viral
286.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Team India players, including Shikhar Dhawan, Shubman Gill and Ishan Kishan, dancing on 'Kala Chashma' in the dressing room after their ODI series victory against Zimbabwe in Harare. The video was shared by Dhawan and Gill on their Instagram handles. Commenting on the video, Yuvraj Singh jokingly wrote, "Stick to cricket lads."

287.title: Elon Musk subpoenas Twitter ex-CEO Jack Dorsey in $44 bn takeover lawsuit
287.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk has subpoenaed his friend and former Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey as he attempts to back out of the $44 billion acquisition deal. Dorsey is being asked for documents relating to the merger as well as information on spam accounts on Twitter. Twitter and Musk are headed for a trial over the merger in October.

288.title: Law considers women as 'weaker section' of society requiring more protection: HC
288.article_body: The Bombay High Court last week transferred a matrimonial case observing that a "lady's inconvenience needs to be given more priority because the law considers women as class belonging to weaker section of society and needs more protection". The court granted relief to a woman who had sought transfer of her matrimonial dispute from Pune to Thane.

289.title: Subsidies on EVs won't be very healthy beyond a point: Delhi Minister
289.article_body: Delhi Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot said it would not be "very healthy" to provide subsidies to buyers of electric vehicles beyond a point. "Subsidies are good to create demand...EVs have to be within the reach of the common person eventually," he added. Delhi government has set a target of one charging point in a radius of three kilometres, Gahlot stated.

290.title: 30-yr-old Mumbai man posts 'derogatory' content on Prophet on WhatsApp; held
290.article_body: A 30-year-old man was arrested in Mumbai's Malad for allegedly using derogatory content on Prophet Mohammed on his WhatsApp status. An FIR was registered on charges under Information Technology Act sections 295A and 67A. Reports said the accused, who is a real estate agent, was produced before a magistrate's court and has been remanded in police custody for two days.

291.title: Dad Anil doesn't see himself as grandparent, he's scared: Sonam Kapoor
291.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor, who recently welcomed her first child, said that her father and actor Anil Kapoor does not see himself as a grandparent. "I think my dad is scared...for a long time, he didn't even see himself as a parent," she added. However, Sonam revealed that it was Anil who got emotional after she told him she was expecting.

292.title: Ford to lay off 3,000 employees in India, US & Canada to slash costs
292.article_body: Ford Motor has confirmed that it is cutting 3,000 salaried and contract jobs in India, US and Canada as the carmaker looks to slash costs. In a memo to staff, CEO Jim Farley said the company is "eliminating work, as well as reorganising and simplifying functions". He also acknowledged that Ford's cost structure "is uncompetitive versus traditional and new competitors".

293.title: Manchester United defeat Liverpool 2-1 to record their 1st win of season
293.article_body: Manchester United defeated Liverpool 2-1 in Premier League 2022-23 at Old Trafford to register their first victory of the season, after having lost to Brighton and Brentford. Jadon Sancho opened the scoring for United in the 16th minute. Marcus Rashford made it 2-0 in the 53rd minute. Mohamed Salah scored the lone goal for Liverpool in the 81st minute.

294.title: Inter-state drug peddlers arrested in Hyd, 590 kg of ganja seized
294.article_body: A Special Operation Team of the LB Nagar Zone, along with Abdullapurmet Police, arrested six people and seized 590 kg of ganja. According to the release, the prime accused got involved in the illegal transportation of ganja in 2019. The police arrested the six accused, along with eight mobile phones, cash worth ₹1,900, a car and a pickup vehicle.

295.title: Man sexually assaults 30-yr-old woman, holds her captive in Delhi
295.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly sexually abusing a 30-year-old woman and holding her captive in Delhi, police said on Monday. The accused established a physical relationship with the victim in UP's Shahjahanpur on the pretext of marriage, said ASP (city) Sanjay Kumar, adding that the accused took her to Delhi, where she was raped and kept locked up.

296.title: Mohammad Hasnain named Shaheen Afridi's replacement for Asia Cup 2022
296.article_body: Pacer Mohammad Hasnain has been named the replacement for pacer Shaheen Afridi in Pakistan's 15-member squad for Asia Cup 2022. Shaheen was ruled out of Asia Cup after being advised a four to six weeks rest by the medical team following an injury to his right knee ligament. Hasnain is currently in UK, playing for Oval Invincibles in The Hundred.

297.title: I never asked anyone why: Chahal on not being included in India's T20 WC 2021 squad
297.article_body: Talking about being snubbed from Team India's T20 World Cup 2021 squad, Yuzvendra Chahal said, "I never asked anyone why because that's not in my control." He added, "Obviously, you feel bad that you aren't a part of the World Cup, but they might have thought that someone else was better and fair enough."

298.title: Delhi logs 625 new COVID-19 cases, 7 deaths; active infections drop
298.article_body: Delhi on Monday reported 625 new COVID-19 cases with a positivity rate of 9.27%, as per data shared by the health department. The national capital also recorded seven deaths due to the infection. The city witnessed a decline in its active caseload as the active case count dropped from 5,141 on Sunday to 4,645 on Monday, according to available data.

299.title: Man Utd preparing €94 million bid for Ajax winger Antony: Reports
299.article_body: Manchester United are reportedly readying a €94 million bid for manager Erik Ten Hag's long-term target, Ajax winger Antony. The player and the Premier League club have reportedly agreed on personal terms but Ajax are reportedly reluctant to let the forward go. Antony sat out Ajax's last match and has allegedly not been training with the team.

300.title: Road accident kills 4, injures 18 in Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur
300.article_body: In the Saharanpur district of UP, a road accident killed at least four and injured 18 people after a speeding car hit a tractor trolley, the police said. The accident took place on the Muzaffarnagar-Saharanpur highway and police rushed to the spot immediately to begin rescue operations, said Deputy Superintendent of Police Ramkaran. Those injured were rushed to a hospital.

301.title: Azaan on loudspeakers doesn't violate fundamental rights of others: K'taka HC
301.article_body: The Karnataka High Court has said that azaan on loudspeakers does not violate the fundamental right of people of other faiths. Hearing a PIL, which claimed that the "contents of the azaan are hurting the believers of other religious faiths", the division bench refused to order mosques to stop playing azaan on loudspeakers. The PIL was filed by Manjunath Halawar.

302.title: Aligarh college students booked for pro-Pak slogans at Tiranga rally
302.article_body: A few college students in Aligarh have been booked on the basis of a video showing them raising pro-Pakistan slogans during a Tiranga rally. The principal and college manager have also been booked after they allegedly took no action when the matter was reported to them. The principal said he received no evidence to back up the claim.

303.title: Railway Board rejects Delhi-Varanasi bullet train feasibility report
303.article_body: The Railway Board has rejected the Delhi-Varanasi bullet train feasibility report in a review meeting that took place last week, officials said. They added that the high-speed train will be unable to run at 350 kmph due to the multiple curves on the route between Delhi and Varanasi. Another official added that the detailed project report (DPR) is awaited.

304.title: Tyson Fury hints at coming out of retirement to fight Oleksandr Usyk
304.article_body: British boxer Tyson Fury has indicated that he is ready to come out of retirement to take on heavyweight champion Oleksandr Usyk. "I'd annihilate both of them...If you want those belts back then...send me in," said Fury on Instagram about the Usyk-Anthony Joshua championship fight. Fury, who is undefeated, had announced his retirement earlier this month.

305.title: Rafael Nadal to be seeded second as Zverev withdraws from US Open
305.article_body: World number two Alexander Zverev has withdrawn from the 2022 US Open due to not recovering from his ankle injury, leaving Rafael Nadal to be seeded second in the draw. Defending champion Daniil Medvedev will keep the top spot. It is still uncertain whether Novak Djokovic will feature in the tournament. The Grand Slam will begin on August 29.

306.title: PM Modi is betraying his own assurances of legally guaranteed MSP: Yechury
306.article_body: CPI(M) leader Sitaram Yechury has criticised PM Narendra Modi for allegedly failing to provide the Minimum Support Price to the country's farmers for their produce. "[PM] Modi is betraying his own assurances of legally guaranteed MSP to all farmers & all crops when their mighty struggle forced the repeal of farm laws. This betrayal will not be allowed," Yechury tweeted.

307.title: Campus Front of India to agitate against education's 'saffronisation' in Karnataka
307.article_body: The Campus Front of India, the student wing of the Popular Front of India, has announced to launch an agitation against the alleged "saffronisation" of education. The student group announced that it will start a month-long campaign called 'Detox Education Deport Hindutva' on August 25. Notably, the campaign will be held across different colleges in Karnataka and elsewhere.

308.title: All Imams coming from outside Assam have to get registered: CM
308.article_body: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said "imams and other people coming to madrassas from outside state" have to register their names on a portal. Sarma asked people to notify the police, who would conduct verification if an unknown Imam came to a village. Sarma earlier said tech-savvy foreign terrorists were threatening to turn Assam into an 'Islamist hub'.

309.title: Malik refuses legal aid over refusal for physical court appearance
309.article_body: Jailed separatist leader Yasin Malik has refused legal aid and reiterated his stand on appearing physically for hearings in the killing of four IAF personnel in 1990. Malik is currently in Delhi's Tihar Jail and is attending hearings via video conference. He had gone on a 10-day hunger strike in July against the Centre to accept his demands.

310.title: AAP ignoring excise policy suggestions led to ₹900 crore loss: BJP
310.article_body: The BJP has claimed that AAP did not incorporate recommendations made by the committee it constituted into the new excise policy, leading to at least ₹900 crore loss. They alleged that AAP kept "changing the goalpost" every time tough questions were asked. BJP also refuted Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's claims of getting charges dropped for joining the party.

311.title: Chhattisgarh govt employees on strike to demand DA hike to 34%
311.article_body: Employees of the Chhattisgarh government went on an indefinite strike on Monday demanding that the dearness allowance (DA) be increased to 34% instead of the present 28%. The employees also demanded that the HRA (house rent allowance) be increased on par with that received by central government employees. Recently, the state announced the DA increase by 6 percentage points.

312.title: It was tough watching friends play for India: Samson on being in and out of team
312.article_body: Talking about being in and out of Team India, Sanju Samson said, "To be very honest...I believe everything you go through impacts you in positive manner." He added, "It was tough watching all your friends play for the country...but I really enjoyed playing those domestic games in that period." Samson won Man of the Match award in second Zimbabwe ODI.

313.title: Creator programme Born on Instagram to be available in Kannada
313.article_body: Instagram's creator programme, Born on Instagram (BoI), will be available in Kannada from September after already being available in Malayalam, Hindi and English. To expand it's vision across India, BoI helps creators interact with other influencers and learn to monetise their brand both online and offline. The BoI programme is available on Instagram's website and is free of cost.

314.title: 23-yr-old Pune techie who's Musk's 'Twitter friend' meets the Tesla CEO, shares pic
314.article_body: Pranay Pathole, the 23-year-old Pune techie, who is billionaire Tesla CEO Elon Musk's 'Twitter friend', met Musk at Tesla's Texas factory and shared a picture. "[I have] never seen such a humble and down-to-earth person," said Pathole while sharing a picture from the meeting. "You're an inspiration to millions," Pathole added.

315.title: Gill dedicates 1st int'l ton to father, says 'He schooled me after I got out in 2nd ODI'
315.article_body: Team India opener Shubman Gill on Monday dedicated his first-ever international hundred to his father. After slamming a hundred against Zimbabwe in the third ODI, Shubman said, "My father has been my primary coach. I got a schooling after I got out in the second ODI, so I dedicate this to him." Shubman was dismissed for 33(34) in second ODI.

316.title: Told him not to dive, but realised he is also 'Afridi': Shahid Afridi on Shaheen's injury
316.article_body: A fan requested former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi on Twitter that he should come out of retirement as fast bowler Shaheen Afridi is out injured. Shahid replied, "I had told him that he is a fast bowler and he should not dive as he can get injured. But later I realised he is also 'Afridi'."

317.title: India has over 3,000 deep-tech startups: NASSCOM report
317.article_body: As per a new report by the National Association of Software and Services Companies (NASSCOM), India has become home to over 3,000 deep-tech startups, as of 2021. The deep-tech startups in India have grown at a compounded annual growth rate (CAGR) of 53% over the last 10 years. Comparatively at a nascent stage, they have also employed over 4,000 people.

318.title: Feels good: Rahul after India complete 3-0 ODI series whitewash vs Zimbabwe
318.article_body: Following India's 3-0 ODI series whitewash over Zimbabwe, India captain KL Rahul said it feels good, adding his side came to Harare with good ideas. "We wanted to be out in...middle and use this time. The players have been very professional, very happy with the result," he further said. India beat Zimbabwe by 13 runs in third ODI today.

319.title: Had made 3 nineties but wanted to get a century: Gill on his maiden int'l ton
319.article_body: Speaking about his maiden international ton (130) in third ODI against Zimbabwe, India opener Shubman Gill stated, "It's always special to get a hundred...had made three nineties but wanted to get a century." He added, "I was just trying to minimise my dot-ball percentage, trying to time the ball." Gill was adjudged both 'Player of the Match and Series'.

320.title: BJD welcome to join NDA, says Union Minister Ramdas Athawale
320.article_body: Union Minister and Republican Party of India (Athawale) chief Ramdas Athawale on Monday said that Odisha's ruling Biju Janata Dal (BJD) is welcome to join the National Democratic Alliance (NDA). He highlighted that the NDA-led Centre usually receives BJD's support in the parliament. Athawale added, "[PM] Narendra Modi can allocate more budget for the state's (Odisha) development."

321.title: He will never feel alone when he's around people who love him: Virat Kohli's manager
321.article_body: Following Virat Kohli's interview on mental health wherein he said he sometimes felt alone even in a room full of people who love him, Kohli's manager Bunty Sajdeh said, "He has experienced mental challenges at only a certain stage in his career." He added, "Virat, for one, will never feel alone when he’s around people who love and support him."

322.title: Jupiter's auroras seen in detail in new pics from world's most powerful telescope
322.article_body: The world's most powerful telescope, NASA's James Webb Space Telescope, has taken two new pictures of Jupiter, which captured its auroras and rings in detail. The pictures show Jupiter with its rings which are "a million times fainter than the planet" as well as two tiny moons, ESA said. Galaxies are also seen as "photobombing" one of the pictures.

323.title: Shilpa Shetty does yoga post-fracture in a wheelchair, shares video
323.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty Kundra, who fractured her leg during a shoot, has shared a video of her doing yoga in a wheelchair. "Even though the injury needs me to take it easy, inactivity can make you rusty," she wrote while sharing the video on her Instagram handle. "Don't let anything get in the way of your routine," Shilpa further wrote.

324.title: Number of lawyers have dwindled in Parliament: CJI Ramana
324.article_body: CJI NV Ramana has said that the Parliament was earlier dominated by legal professionals. "As a result, we got outstanding Constitution and flawless laws. Nowadays the number of lawyers has dwindled and that space is taken by others," CJI Ramana said. He added that Jagdeep Dhankhar's elevation to the Vice-President's post is a "tribute to our rich constitutional values".

325.title: SC notice to Gujarat government on Teesta Setalvad's bail plea
325.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) has issued notice to the Gujarat government on a bail plea filed by activist Teesta Setalvad, who was arrested for allegedly fabricating evidence in the 2002 riots cases. The state has been asked to reply by August 25. SC said it'll also consider whether it can give bail while the Gujarat HC is hearing the case.

326.title: Explosives-laden bag found in Swedish capital destroyed by police
326.article_body: Police in Sweden's capital Stockholm disposed of an explosives-filled bag that was found in a park late on Sunday night, they said on Monday. A preliminary investigation has been initiated in the case. No one has been taken in custody so far. The park, where the bag was found, hosted Stockholm's annual cultural festival from August 17 to August 21.

327.title: Fan's 'Can I have your shirt?' banner comes on big screen, Dhawan's reaction goes viral
327.article_body: During the third Zimbabwe-India ODI in Harare, the big screen showed a fan holding a poster that read, "Shikhar...can I have your shirt?" The camera then showed Shikhar Dhawan sitting in the dressing room. On seeing the big screen, Shikhar pretended to remove his shirt, after which teammates around him were seen laughing. India won the ODI by 13 runs.

328.title: Ex-Punjab minister arrested from salon on corruption charges
328.article_body: Punjab Congress Working President and former state minister Bharat Bhushan Ashu was arrested from a hair salon in Ludhiana on corruption charges. Ashu, who was the food and supplies minister, was arrested in connection with the food grains transportation tender case. A video showed Ashu sitting on a chair in the salon, while vigilance officials arrived to arrest him.

329.title: 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' to re-release in theatres with additional footage
329.article_body: Tom Holland's 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' is returning to the theatres with an extended version. Sony Pictures on Monday announced that the film will be re-released on September 2 and will feature "with all-new additional footage", which didn't make it in the first theatrical cut. In India, the film will release in English and Hindi.

330.title: An influential personality made fake promise of a film: Asim
330.article_body: Actor Asim Riaz said an "influential personality" made "fake promises" to his father of a film. He said for more than a year, the makers used his name to bring the film under media's limelight. "The pressure and anxiety they have given me will never make me stop doing what I am doing right now," he said.

331.title: Man rapes & kills girl, mutilates her face after she sees him with her mother in Delhi
331.article_body: A man has been arrested in Delhi for kidnapping, raping and murdering a minor girl whose mother was in a relationship with the accused, police said. The accused committed the crime after the victim saw him in "a compromising position" with her mother, said Delhi DCP Shweta Chauhan. He also mutilated the girl's face and hid her body, Chauhan said.

332.title: Tiger's 'Screw Dheela' not shelved, shoot to commence in 2023: Makers
332.article_body: The makers of Tiger Shroff-starrer 'Screw Dheela' have issued a statement refuting reports that claimed that the film has been shelved due to budget issues and average response to the film's announcement video. The statement shared by the makers clarified that the film has been delayed due to date issues. 'Screw Dheela' will go on floors in 2023, it said.

333.title: Manipur minor allegedly raped by father succumbs after suicide bid
333.article_body: A 15-year-old girl who was allegedly raped by her father several times since 2016 and attempted suicide by consuming poison died of multiple organ failure in a hospital in Manipur's capital Imphal on Sunday. The victim had allegedly consumed pesticide on July 31 and was hospitalised on August 3. The accused is currently under judicial custody.

334.title: Ananya gives acting tips to Shanaya & Suhana: Actress' mom Bhavana
334.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday's mother Bhavana Pandey has said her daughter gives acting tips to her friends Shanaya Kapoor and Suhana Khan. "Ananya has a lot of learning to do still but whatever she has learned...she's sharing...with Shanaya and Suhana," Bhavana added. Shanaya will make her debut with 'Bedhadak' while Zoya Akhtar's 'The Archies' will mark Suhana's acting debut.

335.title: Congress' internal condition is in shambles: Scindia on Sharma's exit
335.article_body: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia on Monday joined the discussion around Congress leader Anand Sharma's exit as the Chairman of the Steering Committee for Himachal polls and said that Congress' internal condition is in shambles. Sharma, while tendering his resignation, said that he had no choice but to resign "due to continuous insults and exclusion".

336.title: Siddaramaiah ate meat before visiting temple, it's an insult: BJP
336.article_body: BJP leaders in Karnataka have criticised Congress leader Siddaramaiah for reportedly going to a temple after eating non-vegetarian food and have accused him of hurting religious sentiments. "Siddaramaiah or anyone should not hurt the feelings of the faithful. If you (Siddaramaiah) have guts, eat pork and visit a mosque," said BJP MLA Basanagouda Patil Yatnal.

337.title: 15 Chinese nationals illegally staying in India detained in UP
337.article_body: Fifteen Chinese nationals staying without valid visas in Uttar Pradesh's Gautam Buddha Nagar district were detained by police on Monday. "They are being sent to a detention centre in Delhi and will be subsequently deported to their country," police said in a statement. This comes after a Chinese national, who was staying illegally in Greater Noida, was arrested in June.

338.title: Kerala's gender-neutral education policy will bring decency into classrooms: BJP
338.article_body: BJP leader and former Union Minister KJ Alphons has said that the Kerala government's gender-neutral education policy in schools will bring "decency" into the classrooms. "The move of the Kerala government towards gender equality is a good thing. Boys and girls will sit together. They don't need to meet one another as strangers," Alphons said.

339.title: Principal arrested for molesting 17-year-old student in Amethi
339.article_body: A private school principal has been arrested for allegedly molesting a 17-year-old female student of his school in UP's Amethi. The incident took place when the girl was reportedly asked by the accused to come to school during a holiday to fill out a form. The police have charged the accused under relevant IPC and POCSO sections.

340.title: A job well done: Jaffer on India's 3-0 ODI series whitewash over Zimbabwe
340.article_body: After India whitewashed Zimbabwe 3-0 following their 13-run win in third ODI in Harare, Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter and wrote, "A job well done. Congratulations Team India on the clinical series win." He added, "Also Sikandar Raza is a special player, gave the passionate Harare crowd lots to cheer [for]." Zimbabwe were bowled out for 276 in 49.3 overs.

341.title: Congo confirms new case of Ebola linked to 2018 outbreak
341.article_body: A confirmed case of Ebola has been detected in Beni city, Congo's National Institute for Biomedical Research said on Monday. Through genetic sequencing, the case was found to be linked to the 2018-2020 outbreak in North Kivu province, the institute informed. WHO earlier said that a suspected case was under investigation after a woman with Ebola-like symptoms died in Beni.

342.title: Security increased in Punjab's Mohali ahead of PM's visit on Aug 24
342.article_body: Punjab Police have increased security in Mohali in the wake of PM Narendra Modi’s visit on August 24. PM Modi will inaugurate the Homi Bhabha Cancer Hospital and Research Centre at Mohali's Mullanpur. During PM Modi's visit to Punjab in January this year, his convoy was disrupted and he was stuck on a flyover near Ferozepur for over 15 minutes.

343.title: My best results come when I'm smiling, having fun: US Open champion Raducanu
343.article_body: Talking about the advice she would like to give her younger self ahead of US Open 2022, 19-year-old Emma Raducanu said, "I'd say to have fun because it just makes what you're doing so enjoyable." She added, "My best results come when I'm smiling, enjoying it and having fun." Raducanu won the women's singles title at US Open last year.

344.title: Ukraine's football league to restart, all stadiums to have bomb shelters
344.article_body: Amid the war with Russia, Ukraine's football league is set to begin as Shakhtar Donetsk will play Metalist 1925 in Kharkiv on Tuesday. "This will be a unique competition: It will happen during a war, during military aggression, during bombardments," said Ukraine's football association head. All matches will be played near Kyiv and all stadiums will have a bomb shelter.

345.title: Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan shares 1st post on Instagram since cruise drugs case
345.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan took to Instagram to share his first post since the cruise drugs case in which he was arrested last year. Sharing pictures with his brother AbRam and sister Suhana, he wrote, "Hat-trick." Shah Rukh commented on the post, writing, "Why I don’t have these pictures!!!!!! Give them to me NOW!"

346.title: China to start issuing visas to Indian students again after over 2 years
346.article_body: China has announced plans to issue visas for Indian students wishing to go back to study in China, after over two years of delay due to COVID-19 restrictions. The new relaxed visa rules will come into effect from August 24 onward, the Chinese embassy in India said. External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar had earlier raised the issue with China.

347.title: Abhishek, Anees Bazmee attend Abdul Gaffar Nadiadwala's funeral
347.article_body: Celebrities including Abhishek Bachchan, Anees Bazmee, Madhur Bhandarkar and Sajid Nadiadwala attended the funeral of late producer Abdul Gaffar Nadiadwala, who passed away aged 91. He was known for producing films like 'Welcome', 'Hera Pheri' and 'Lahoo Ke Do Rang'. He died early Monday morning due to cardiac arrest at Breach Candy Hospital in Mumbai.
