348.title: Man Utd-bound Casemiro breaks down as he bids farewell to Real Madrid
348.article_body: Brazilian midfielder Casemiro broke down as he bid farewell to La Liga club Real Madrid after being with them for nine years. "When I got here...my wife and I knew nobody...the greatest honour was to come here to work every day," said Casemiro. The player agreed a transfer to Manchester United in a deal reported to be worth £70 million.

349.title: Prabhas' next with Siddharth Anand to go on floors mid-2023: Reports
349.article_body: Prabhas is reportedly collaborating with director Siddharth Anand for his next action-thriller. As per reports, the film will go on floors in mid-2023 after Prabhas and Siddharth wrap their respective projects. The film, which reportedly will be produced by Mythri Movie Makers, is said to be a big budgeted project. It will be shot in India and abroad.

350.title: Prepared for everything now: Shehnaaz on life post Sidharth’s demise
350.article_body: Shehnaaz Gill said Sidharth Shukla's death has prepared her for everything to come. The actress said the grief she has experienced last year has made her "very strong" as a person. Addressing the trolling against her song 'Tu Yaheen Hai', which was released after Sidharth's death, Shehnaaz said it was her way to pay tribute to him before resuming work.

351.title: Used to find my right profile 'ugly', would ask photographers to not shoot: Vidya
351.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan on Instagram recalled the times when she would request filmmakers or photographers to not shoot her right profile as she found it "ugly". But with time, Vidya said she is "no longer scared" to flaunt all her sides. "What changed is the way I looked at myself and that changed how I see myself," she said.

352.title: Always wanted to do a Dharma film: Arjun Bijlani on ‘Rocky Aur Rani…’
352.article_body: Actor Arjun Bijlani will be seen in Karan Johar's film 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani'. While the film stars him in a guest appearance, Arjun said he hopes "to do bigger things" under Dharma Productions. "From childhood...I wanted to do a Dharma film," he said, adding that being in the Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt-starrer was his "Dharma moment".

353.title: I think Shakib is going to re-energise Bangladesh: Shane Watson
353.article_body: After Bangladesh all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan was appointed as the skipper for the upcoming Asia Cup, former Australian cricketer Shane Watson said that the move is going to "re-energise" the team. "He's (Shakib) so experienced...His decision-making...under pressure is going to be invaluable," Watson said. He added that he will be "very surprised" if Shakib doesn't "dominate" the Asia Cup.

354.title: Shanghai United Imaging shares jump 75% after $1.6 bn IPO
354.article_body: Pharmaceutical company Shanghai United Imaging shares surged 75% to 192.48 yuan on the first day of trading after its $1.6 billion Initial Public Offering (IPO). The company raised 10.99 billion yuan in its IPO which was more than 3,500 times oversubscribed among retail investors. This is seventh Chinese listing this year that has an offering of more than $1 billion.

355.title: Police lathicharge Raj students gathered for student election rally
355.article_body: Police on Monday lathicharged students, who had allegedly gathered without permission on university and college campuses in several cities in Rajasthan, during filing of nominations for the students' union elections. Narendra Yadav, ABVP candidate for the President's post in Jaipur's Rajasthan University, held a show of strength with a large number of his supporters during nomination, police said.

356.title: 'Brahmastra 2' to feature Deepika-Ranveer with Alia-Ranbir: Reports
356.article_body: Ahead of Brahmastra Part One's release, rumours are suggesting that the sequel of the Ayan Mukerji trilogy will feature Deepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh in pivotal roles. As per reports, Deepika-Ranveer's story will run parallel to Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor's story in 'Brahmastra 2'. The trilogy will reportedly be interlinked with many actors featuring in cameos.

357.title: I think it's great, you get used to each other: Alia on live-in relationships
357.article_body: Alia Bhatt during a recent interview opened up about the concept of live-in relationships, saying, "If you can, why not? I think it's great." "You get used to each other, you get comfortable, you build so many memories without the pressure and that baggage or like 'shaadi karni hai (we want to get married)'. To each his own," Alia added.

358.title: Skye Air to focus on long range delivery of medicines in Kolkata
358.article_body: Drone startup Skye Air Mobility in partnership with Flipkart Health+ will be taking up long range deliveries of medicines at a distance of 60-70 km in Kolkata and suburban areas as part of its ongoing trials. So far, Skye Mobility was delivering medicines at a maximum distance of 16 km. The trials will go on till September 8, 2022.

359.title: Odisha govt must check atrocities on Dalits and tribals: Athawale
359.article_body: Union Minister Ramdas Athawale has urged the Odisha government to "take steps to check atrocities" on Dalits and tribals in the state. Addressing a press conference in Bhubaneswar, Athawale said that Odisha recorded 2,828 cases of crime against Dalits and tribals in 2020-21. He added that there was a need to encourage inter-caste marriages to end discrimination.

360.title: Adidas CEO Kasper Rorsted to step down in 2023
360.article_body: Adidas announced that its CEO Kasper Rorsted will be stepping down next year. Rorsted, who led Adidas since 2016, will remain in the position till his successor is found, Adidas said. His contract was renewed for five years in 2020. "Enabling a restart in 2023 is the right thing to do, both for the company and me personally," Rorsted said.

361.title: Cong 'unanimously' in Rahul's favour for party President post: Raj CM
361.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Monday said the party is "unanimously" in favour of Rahul Gandhi becoming the next Congress President. "If Rahul Gandhi does not become the party President, it will be a disappointment for Congress supporters in the country. Many people will sit at home and we will suffer," CM Gehlot said.

362.title: Nearly 9,000 personnel lost in war with Russia: Ukrainian general
362.article_body: General Valeriy Zaluzhnyi, chief of Ukrainian armed forces, on Monday said Ukraine has lost nearly 9,000 military personnel in the ongoing war with Russia. Zaluzhnyi did not specify if the figure included all service personnel killed in action, such as border guards. Notably, Ukraine on Sunday claimed that 45,000 Russian military personnel had been killed in the conflict thus far.

363.title: Binged 'Game of Thrones' in 2 weeks: House of the Dragon's Milly Alcock
363.article_body: 'House of the Dragon' actress Milly Alcock said she "binged" all eight seasons of 'Game of Thrones' in two weeks to prepare herself for its prequel. She said she found it "intense" and understood why everyone loved it. Alcock said she was in "shock and disbelief" to find out that she will play Rhaenyra Targaryen in the show.

364.title: Not doing it due to agreement issues: Krushna on 'The Kapil Sharma Show'
364.article_body: 'The Kapil Sharma Show' (TKSS), which is returning with its new season, will not feature Krushna Abhishek. The actor confirmed the news and said, "Not doing it. Agreement issues." The upcoming season of the Kapil Sharma-hosted show will introduce the audience to some new artistes. The makers will soon officially announce the show's premiere date.

365.title: BCB President Nazmul Hassan keeps me under pressure: Shakib Al Hasan
365.article_body: Bangladesh skipper Shakib Al Hasan said that BCB President Nazmul Hassan keeps him "under pressure". "So there is some chance of pressure being there. Since it's a challenging position and the board felt that I was the best option available, maybe that's why they chose me," Shakib said. The all-rounder has been appointed as the skipper for the Asia Cup.

366.title: How much prize money did Praggnanandhaa win from event in which he defeated Carlsen?
366.article_body: India's 17-year-old Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa defeated world number one Magnus Carlsen in the FTX Crypto Cup. Praggnanandhaa also defeated world number four Alireza Firouzja, world number nine Anish Giri and world number six Levon Aronian in the tournament. Praggnanandhaa bagged a total prize money of $37,500 in the event after finishing runner-up. Champion Magnus Carlsen won $40,000.

367.title: I believe in coming back to drawing board when things don't go my way: Iyer
367.article_body: All-rounder Venkatesh Iyer, who hasn't played for India since February 2022, said he always believes in coming back to the drawing board and working on his basics when things don't go his way. "I'm working on my fitness and...bowling so that I can add a few clicks to my pace...You need to keep on upgrading yourself," he added.

368.title: 'Sab golmaal hai': BJP shares parody video of Kejriwal
368.article_body: The BJP recently shared a parody video of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and titled it "Golmaal hai bhai sab golmaal hai". The video implies that CM Kejriwal is directly behind corruption in the national capital. The video comes amid a political battle between BJP and AAP over Manish Sisodia's role in the excise policy scam.

369.title: Drunk woman abuses & manhandles auto driver alleging harassment on MP road, video out
369.article_body: A video has shown a woman, who was reportedly drunk, abusing and manhandling an auto driver on a busy road in MP's Gwalior. The woman reportedly got down from the scooter she was riding and started abusing the driver, alleging harassment and eve-teasing on Sunday. She didn't stop even after police were called to the spot.

370.title: Paytm shares jump over 3% after reappointment of Vijay Shekhar Sharma
370.article_body: The share price of the parent company of Paytm, One 97 Communications, rose over 3% after the reappointment of Vijay Shekhar Sharma as the company's Chief Executive Officer (CEO) and Managing Director (MD). 99.67% shareholders of the company voted in favour of the reappointment at company's annual general meeting on August 21. The stock has lost 41.2% in 2022.

371.title: Saudi BNPL platform Tamara raises $100 mn in Series B round
371.article_body: Saudi Arabian buy now, pay later (BNPL) platform, Tamara, has raised $100 million in a Series B funding round. The round was led by Sanabil Investments, which is owned by Saudi Arabia's sovereign fund. Founded in 2020 by Saudi entrepreneurs Abdulmajeed Alsukhan, Turki Bin Zarah and Abdulmohsen Albabtain, Tamara has partnered with companies such as IKEA, SHEIN and Namshi.

372.title: India create record for most ODI series whitewashes in 2022, defeat Zimbabwe 3-0
372.article_body: India defeated Zimbabwe by 13 runs in the third ODI in Harare to complete a 3-0 series whitewash. With this, India created the record for most ODI series whitewashes in 2022 with 3 clean sweeps. India had earlier completed two ODI series whitewashes against West Indies. New Zealand, Pakistan and Afghanistan have registered two ODI series whitewashes each this year.

373.title: Jacqueline makes 1st public appearance since being named accused in extortion case
373.article_body: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez was spotted in Mumbai on Monday for the first time since she was named as an accused in an extortion case. Last week, Jacqueline was named in the chargesheet filed by the ED in the ₹200-crore extortion case connected to conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar. On Monday, Jacqueline was seen at a temple paying her respects.

374.title: At least 20 dead due to flash floods in Afghanistan
374.article_body: Flash floods have killed at least 20 people in the Logar province of Afghanistan over the last 48 hours, the country's disaster management authority said on Monday. Another 35 people have been injured due to the flooding, officials added. Notably, more than 1,000 people were killed in a massive earthquake that hit the country in June this year.

375.title: Indian YouTubers tweet 'chess is the new cricket'; world number 1 Carlsen reacts
375.article_body: After India's R Praggnanandhaa defeated world number 1 chess player Magnus Carlsen, Indian YouTubers, Abhi and Niyu, tweeted, "Chess is the new cricket. Prove me wrong!" Carlsen reacted to the tweet, listing reasons "why chess isn't cricket", and said, "Cricket is played on a field...chess is played on a board...Cricket has bat and ball, chess...doesn't...I can't play cricket."

376.title: 12 people missing in U'khand amid heavy rain; sniffer dogs deployed
376.article_body: The Uttarakhand State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) on Monday deployed four sniffer dogs in Sarkhet village to trace 12 people, who are feared trapped under debris for over 48 hours, SDRF Commandant Manikant Mishra said. Torrential rainfall had caused severe damage to properties in Dehradun and Tehri Garhwal districts, the official added. Sarkhet was struck by a cloudburst on Saturday.

377.title: Indians Srikanth, Prannoy reach 2nd round at World Championships 2022
377.article_body: India's Kidambi Srikanth defeated Nhat Nguyen of Ireland 22-20, 21-19 to enter the men's singles second round at Badminton World Championships 2022 in Tokyo on Monday. The 2021 silver medallist won the match in 51 minutes. Unseeded Indian HS Prannoy defeated Luka Wraber of Austria 21-12, 21-11. In the men's doubles, MR Arjun and Dhruv Kapila entered the second round.

378.title: Mamata announces 11-day Puja holidays, ₹60,000 grant for Puja clubs
378.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Monday announced government holidays for Durga Puja from September 30 to October 10. She also added that the Puja committees will get financial assistance of ₹60,000, an increase of ₹10,000 from last year. "We will also provide them a rebate of 60% on the electricity bill," Banerjee added.

379.title: Sidharth & Kiara in talks for Shashank Khaitan's rom-com film: Report
379.article_body: Actors Sidharth Malhotra and Kiara Advani, who are rumoured to be dating each other, are reportedly in talks for a rom-com film which will be directed by Shashank Khaitan. The upcoming film will go on the floors by the end of this year, the report said. It will be produced by Karan Johar's Dharma Productions, the report further said.

380.title: 3 bathing in rivers drown in Nainital in 2 incidents; 1 missing
380.article_body: Three persons, including two teenagers, who went into rivers for a bath drowned in two separate incidents in Uttarakhand's Nainital in the last 24 hours, police said on Monday, adding that a fourth person is still missing. In one of the incidents, some children raised an alarm after spotting the two teenagers being washed away due to strong water currents.

381.title: Beating Nadal in middle of tournament felt great: Cincinnati Open champ Coric
381.article_body: Asked about his thoughts on winning match after match at Cincinnati Open 2022, including one against Rafael Nadal, champion Borna Coric said he felt great after beating the 22-time Grand Slam champion in middle of the tournament. "I was just believing that I can win the next match. That's what I did for five days in a row," he added.

382.title: Pique among Barca players not happy with Dembele's new contract: Reports
382.article_body: Barcelona players Gerard Pique, Sergio Busquets, and Jordi Alba are reportedly not happy after details of winger Ousmane Dembele's new contract came to light. The three senior players have taken salary cuts over the last two years to help the team register new players. Meanwhile, leaks suggest Dembele has clauses in his contract which could see him earn £20 million/season.

383.title: Kejriwal is a 'big liar', his Ministers are 'bigger' liars: BJP
383.article_body: Union Minister and BJP leader Anurag Thakur on Monday called Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal a "big liar" and his Ministers "bigger liars". His remark came following Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's claim that BJP offered him the CM's post if he broke AAP. Kejriwal's model of governance has shifted from "mohalla clinics" to "mohalla thekas", Thakur added.

384.title: 4 killed, 11 injured as truck rams into SUV carrying students in MP
384.article_body: Four students died and 11 others sustained injuries after a speeding truck rammed into an SUV carrying 15 school students in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain on Monday, police said. Eyewitnesses said an ambulance reached the spot 15 minutes after the incident and passersby took the students to a hospital in a passenger bus. CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan has condoled the deaths.

385.title: Runner-up Odinga challenges Kenya's Prez poll result in top court
385.article_body: Raila Odinga, runner-up of Kenyan presidential polls, on Monday challenged the election results in the Supreme Court. In his petition, Odinga sought nullification of the vote's outcome. He argued that there was a mismatch between the turnout figures and the result. He further contended that the election commission had failed to tally ballots from 27 constituencies as required by law.

386.title: Tired of my 'dabang' reputation, it gets me into trouble unnecessarily: Swara
386.article_body: Swara Bhasker, who'll be seen alongside Shikha Talsania, Meher Vij and Pooja Chopra in 'Jahaan Chaar Yaar', has said she asked the film's writer-director Kamal Pandey to give her the "most shy" character in the film. "I told him...I'm tired of this 'dabang' reputation of mine. I'm fed up of this reputation, which gets me into trouble unnecessarily," Swara added.

387.title: Women share videos of themselves partying in Finland after PM Sanna criticised
387.article_body: Women in Finland are sharing videos of themselves dancing and partying to show support for PM Sanna Marin who was criticised after a video of her partying with her friends went viral. The women are sharing the video with the hashtag 'Solidarity with Sanna' on Twitter. Marin was accused of taking drugs after the video went viral.

388.title: 4-yr-old Gurugram girl gets raped after being lured with toffees
388.article_body: A four-year-old girl was allegedly molested and forced to have oral sex with a 23-year-old man in Gurugram. The accused, Sahil alias Nitu, allegedly took the girl to his home after enticing her with toffees, the victim's mother wrote in her complaint. She further alleged that Sahil often molested the minor. The accused has been arrested under the POCSO Act.

389.title: Rajinikanth's first look from 'Jailer' revealed, film goes on floors
389.article_body: The makers of 'Jailer' shared actor Rajinikanth's first look from the Nelson Dilipkumar directorial on Twitter. They also shared that the film went on the floors in Chennai on Monday. The film, which also stars Tamannaah Bhatia and Sanjay Dutt in pivotal roles, marks Rajinikanth's first collaboration with Nelson. It will reportedly be shot entirely on a prison set.

390.title: Heavy rains cause flood-like situation in Kota; schools closed
390.article_body: Heavy rainfall in the last 24 hours has caused a flood-like situation in parts of Rajasthan's Kota and nearby areas like Bundi, Baran, Jhalawar and Tonk. The Kota district administration said that nearly 1,500 people from different parts of the district have been moved and sent to safer places. Schools in the district have also been closed till further orders.

391.title: India's Deepak Chahar 'mankads' Zimbabwe opener, doesn't appeal; video goes viral
391.article_body: A video has gone viral showing India fast bowler Deepak Chahar 'mankading' Zimbabwe opener Innocent Kaia at the start of Zimbabwe's innings in the third ODI in Harare. Chahar removed the bails in his run-up while Innocent was outside his crease. However, Chahar did not appeal and was seen having a word with Innocent, seemingly giving him a warning.

392.title: Hindi films need course correction: Manoj Bajpayee
392.article_body: Commenting on Bollywood's "bad phase" at the box office, actor Manoj Bajpayee said the Hindi film industry needs "course correction". Stating that "Hindi cinema will not die", the actor said, "It will course-correct and come back to its normal self" and will witness a "new exciting phase". His comment came after 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and 'Raksha Bandhan' failed to perform.

393.title: Bollywood has been painted as a dark place after Sushant's death: Swara
393.article_body: Swara Bhasker has spoken about the social media trends demanding boycott of Bollywood films. She claimed the current trend is to spew hate toward Bollywood which gained momentum post Sushant Singh Rajput's demise. "After unfortunate...suicide of Sushant, Bollywood has been painted as a dark place, that is only about drug, alcohol and sex...Unfortunately, Bollywood is being discredited," she said.

394.title: Several hurt as JNU students, staff clash over scholarships; video surfaces
394.article_body: Clashes broke out on the Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) campus in Delhi on Monday between students, led by the Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP), and staff members over scholarship funds. The ABVP has claimed the administration "attacked students for asking for their rightful fellowships". "Many students have been seriously injured," ABVP tweeted, while sharing a video of the incident.

395.title: 3 people, including father and son, killed with spade in Jharkhand
395.article_body: Three people, including a father and his son, were allegedly killed by a relative in Chandidih village in Jharkhand's Khunti district. The accused, Hemant Purty, allegedly used a spade in killing them and was intoxicated while committing the crime, police said. The deceased have been identified as Bitna Munda (65), Suda Munda (25) and Vikas Mahto.

396.title: Girls, boys sitting together in classroom won't lead to gender equality: Cong
396.article_body: Senior Congress leader K Muraleedharan on Sunday said making girls and boys sit together in the classroom will not lead to gender equality. "Not everyone would welcome it. It is not just the Indian Union Muslim League (IUML) which is against it. A lot of people in Kerala have not accepted that concept. It is unnecessary," he said.

397.title: She was an icon: Adnan Sami mourns demise of Pak singer Nayyara Noor
397.article_body: Singer Adnan Sami took to Twitter to share a post mourning the demise of Pakistani singer Nayyara Noor. "Just learned the sad news that legendary singer Nayyara Noor Sahiba has passed away. She was an icon and her contribution to music will be remembered and loved forever," he wrote. Nayyara passed away on Sunday at the age of 71.

398.title: 1 booked after Hanuman idol vandalised in Delhi's Mahendra Park
398.article_body: A case has been registered against a person for allegedly vandalising a Hanuman idol at a small temple in northwest Delhi's Mahendra Park area, police said. A video showing a man with a rod near the temple was reportedly accessed by locals. Police suspect that the accused vandalised the idol in a drunken stupor. He is yet to be arrested.

399.title: India Women are also as talented as other teams: Batter Yastika Bhatia
399.article_body: Speaking about India Women's mindset against England Women in semi-final at CWG 2022, India Women batter Yastika Bhatia said her side had certain plans against certain batters and bowlers and had practised accordingly. "It was all about executing that well on...ground. We're also as talented as other teams...it was all about holding our nerves in crunch situations," she added.

400.title: Supreme Court agrees to hear review petition of PMLA judgement
400.article_body: The Supreme Court has agreed to list a review petition against its earlier judgement which upheld the constitutional validity of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act. When the plea was mentioned, a bench headed by Chief Justice NV Ramana said, "Okay, we will list it." Following the previous verdict, various Opposition parties expressed their apprehension over its 'long-term implications'.

401.title: Maharashtra govt to pay fees of college students who lost both parents to COVID-19
401.article_body: The Maharashtra government will bear the education cost of college students who've lost both their parents to COVID-19, state Minister Chandrakant Patil said. "As many as 931 undergraduate and 228 postgraduate students of various government colleges have lost both their parents to COVID-19," Patil announced in the state Assembly. This will cost the state exchequer over ₹2 crore annually.
